Customer 1.Name: Stanley
Customer 1.Content: Excellent customer service.  Excellent food.  An evening to enjoy

Customer 2.Name: Kat
Customer 2.Content: Great experience. The food was exceptional and the service as well. Would highly recommend

Customer 3.Name: Mariel
Customer 3.Content: We went there for my husband's birthday, from our arrival to the moment we left,  the personnel were very attentive and cared about every detail. We had the crispy pork ear, which was a little too sweet for my taste, but still good and delicious bone marrow to start. After that we had the tomahawk, it was really tender and juicy (you can easily share it among 3 - 4 people). Drinks are also 👌. To finish we had the lemon chiboust dessert as recommended by our waitress but we were not sure about the combination between cilantro and ice cream. Great experience in general.

Customer 4.Name: Helen
Customer 4.Content: Best steak you’ll have your whole life but be sure to bring your savings and get the A5 japanese wagyu! It’ll be worth it!

Customer 5.Name: Charles
Customer 5.Content:
We went for my wife’s birthday and had a very nice time. The food was exceptional and the wait staff was an orchestrated ballet of impeccable service. Everything from the appetizers, the main courses and the desserts were all rock solid. I expected at least one of these categories to be a little weak (as they are with most restaurants) and I was continually pleasantly surprised by the dynamic flavors and incredibly well-prepared, and well-seasoned food overall.

My only critique would be that the broccolini was undercooked for my taste and a little too heavy on the garlic, and the porterhouse rolls were slightly disappointing — they were made of some kind of wheat dough with an added aromatic that wasn’t needed in my opinion. I was hoping for the classic buttery white bread porterhouse rolls! But if you are looking for exotic flavors, and open to things being a little different than expected, there’s no shortage of that at Niku.

The ambience was modern, tasteful and chic. The music was a little loud, but that helped to provide a very immersive experience. After a few drinks you don’t notice as much lol.

They have three different seating options: bar, tables, and chefs counter. This was not as clearly explained as it could’ve been on their website or on OpenTable. The pictures I found online didn’t give a clear enough idea of what the different seating options would look like, so that made planning a special occasion a little difficult.

Otherwise, I couldn’t recommend this place enough.

Customer 6.Name: Audi
Customer 6.Content: Everything on the menu is a must try!! U never feel rushed to eat or order. Definitely an experience and the staff is so attentive and patient.

Customer 7.Name: Athan
Customer 7.Content:
I recently visited Niku with a business colleague and we opted for the Chef's Counter experience. It was an exceptional evening from start to finish. 

Service: The service was impeccable. Our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and genuinely enthusiastic about the dishes, which significantly enhanced our dining experience. 

Ambiance: The ambiance at Niku is stunningly beautiful. The space is designed with an eye for detail that elevates the dining experience. The atmosphere was vibrant; the restaurant was bustling, yet it felt intimate at the Chef's Counter. 

Dining Experience: Sitting at the Chef's Counter was a highlight. Watching the chefs work their magic was not only entertaining but also educational. The menu was inventive, and the flavors were bold yet harmonious. Each course was explained with care, adding depth to the meal.

Overall: Niku is a great find in The City, offering a lively and luxurious dining environment. It's the kind of place you want to return to, and I definitely plan to go back. Whether for business or pleasure, Niku delivers an unforgettable dining experience. Highly recommended for those looking for exceptional Japanese cuisine in a dynamic setting.

Customer 8.Name: Albert
Customer 8.Content: Overall, my family had a nice time at Niku’s. The servers were all nice and provided great service. Most of the food we ordered were delicious, however, the main course of the night, the tomahawk steak, was cooked a little too rare for our taste.

Customer 9.Name: DavidF
Customer 9.Content: Brought my partner here for their birthday and we had such a memorable experience, the staff were fantastic from beginning to end to ensure we had a perfect evening. We loved our steaks and drinks. Pricey but worth it.

Customer 10.Name: David
Customer 10.Content: Great to try and make a place u want to keep in mind for great food different from anyone else

Customer 11.Name: Neilson
Customer 11.Content: The food and service was impeccable! Every dish was a delightful and delicious experience

Customer 12.Name: Dominique
Customer 12.Content: Amazing :) super nice staff, loving seeing the talented chefs cook in front of us

Customer 13.Name: Leif
Customer 13.Content: Excellent, Excellent and Excellent is a fitting description for whatever you would like to ask about this restaurant and dining experience.

Customer 14.Name: Jay
Customer 14.Content: Great food, delicious cocktails, impressive wine program, stellar service, relaxing ambiance. Really welcoming and knowledgeable staff. It was a great experience start to finish. The bone marrow short rib was definitely a highlight but everything was executed well.

Customer 15.Name: Kat
Customer 15.Content: Delicious dinner! Everything melts in your mouth. Will be back!

Customer 16.Name: Greg
Customer 16.Content: This restaurant was the best food I have ever eaten, and according to my son, it was the best restaurant ever. He said the fillet mingon was amazing, and buttery. I loved everything that we ordered, and my family agreed. Shoutout to our server, Eric, who was the nicest and most polite server in the world. He even asked the manager to give him permission to show us the different types of wagyu, which was amazing. Best restaurant ever!

Customer 17.Name: Marc
Customer 17.Content: Best Steakhoude this side of Florence! Highly recommend just don’t overdo the delicious apps and save room for the main event.

Customer 18.Name: Robert
Customer 18.Content:
Food was very good, but not great.
Value for the money was missing if you ask me.

Customer 19.Name: Guinevere
Customer 19.Content: The American Wagyu filet was spectacular, service by Daniel was a delight.  Thank you for a memorable evening!

Customer 20.Name: Audrey
Customer 20.Content: From the get go we were greeted with smiles and anble to accommodate our last minute addition. The service was very thorough making sure we know everything and assisted with pairing if asked.   Amazing food amazing service. What else is there to say?

Customer 21.Name: Rick
Customer 21.Content: We have been here 4-6 times.  As always the food was phenomenal. The service is discrete but attentive.  The tomahawk is cooked perfectly. The bone marrow is unbelievable. The salads are tasty and lightly dressed. The potato stack amazing. We tried pig ears tonight: wow. The deserts have different flavors, different textures and colors.  Mainly good. And one does not get bored with it

Customer 22.Name: Evan
Customer 22.Content: Second time eating here. Both times were excellent. This time we sat at the Chef’s table and nerded out with questions to the Chef (who was really personable). We did a 16 oz Ribeye and the A5 sampler (Ribeye + Filet). As good as it gets… truly. A++.

Customer 23.Name: Carolina
Customer 23.Content: Amazing! ✨✨✨✨✨ Celebrated my fiancé’s birthday here and they were so kind and thoughtful. Steak was amazing, but so was everything else particularly the potatoes. Loved this place and can’t wait to come back. Need to check out their burger next door!

Customer 24.Name: Juliet
Customer 24.Content:
I could have given a better rating, but, my personal meal was horrible, and I got very sick 5 hours after eating there.  There were 4 of us, and everyone elses meal was fine.  I ordered the shoet ribs.  They were over salted, over charred, and a greasy mess.  I didn't know what to expect, maybe this was the way it was suppose to be.  The meat itself was really fatty.  I wish I had them take it back, I didn't know I'd get so sick eating it,.  Plus ruining everyone elses meal by delaying mine, etc.

I do have to say the crunchy pig ears were great.  I might go back there for them, not sure I'd go back for a meal.

Customer 25.Name: Autumn
Customer 25.Content: Amazing!  Sitting at the chef’s table is a must! All the workers were friendly, amazing, and very personable!  Food was spectacular! A definite SF must!

Customer 26.Name: Harwind
Customer 26.Content: Service was amazing, but the food was underwhelming.

Customer 27.Name: Andres
Customer 27.Content: Excelente restaurante de cortes! Festejamos ahí nuestro aniversario y Reuben nos atendió espectacular! Nos recibieron con dos copas de vino espumoso como cortesía. Sentarse en la barra frente a los asadores es un espectáculo y la comida es deliciosa. Las bebidas también muy buenas y con una gran variedad de licores. Muchas felicidades es un must visitar este lugar.

Customer 28.Name: MeredithS
Customer 28.Content: Vibe best thing since sliced bread, are you kidding me you would have to be an idiot to not go.

Customer 29.Name: Matthew
Customer 29.Content:
Exceptional Dinner at Niku Steakhouse

Niku Steakhouse exceeded all expectations. The staff’s incredible service made us feel like VIPs. The ambience was top-notch—beautiful decor with a view into the kitchen added a special touch.

We started with the wagyu charcuterie, which was melt-in-your-mouth amazing. Cocktails were fresh and creative, and the wine was stellar. The 6oz filets were cooked and seasoned perfectly—easily some of the best steaks I’ve had.

It was my wife’s birthday, and they surprised her with sweets and port wine, which made the evening unforgettable. The Japanese sweet potato cake for dessert was the perfect finish. This is hands-down one of San Francisco’s best dining spots. Highly recommend it and will definitely be back.

Customer 30.Name: Tamara
Customer 30.Content: Very lovely special occasion restaurant. We went for a friends birthday and had a great time from hosting to our lead server. Will be back loved this place.

Customer 31.Name: Nancy
Customer 31.Content: Service met expectations. Food over salted and over seasoned. Walked out with high blood pressure and salt burned tongue. Tbh, I’m not sure how they have a Michelin star, only explanation is, they paid for it. I would not recommend this place to family and friends.

Customer 32.Name: Carmen
Customer 32.Content: Ambience is as great and the servers where very friendly. Food was good but I felt we didn’t enjoy the experience, our reservation was at 5pm and by 5:45pm we were finished.

Customer 33.Name: Steve
Customer 33.Content: Absolutely amazing! Sit at the counter if you can and watch the brilliant chefs at work. The appetizers, sides, and of course the steaks are out of this world. The service was impeccable. Whenever I find myself back in SF again, this is the first place I will be going to.

Customer 34.Name: Alyse
Customer 34.Content: Wonderful service from the bar team to the main dining room. Appreciate the guidance on what to order to have a balanced meal. We got lucky and got to sit in the middle center of the chefs bar counter!

Customer 35.Name: Alyssa
Customer 35.Content: The restaurant ambiance was very nice but the A3 wagyu steak that I tried was not worth the price. I asked for medium and it was rare. The texture and flavor was not even close to the wagyu I ate in Japan. The sides were had were very good (oysters, ravioli, potatoes, bone marrow and rice). My husband’s trout was outstanding. Overall it’s a nice one-time experience if you are willing to pay over $400 per person not including drinks or dessert.

Customer 36.Name: Jackie
Customer 36.Content: The food was incredible, especially the crispy pig ears and beef tartare! The sides and steak were also incredible and high quality. A bit expensive, but worth it!

Customer 37.Name: Thang
Customer 37.Content: We came here for our 23rd anniversary and enjoyed the appetizers very much .

Customer 38.Name: Alberto
Customer 38.Content: Phenomenal as always. To start the staff was very patient with me as I called and checked multiple times to ask if they had table seating vs high top. They last minute sat me at a table and it was mega kind of them. That set the tone for the above and beyond experience I’d have from there on out. Niku starters never disappoint with the oysters being ridiculous this time around as well as the pasta. As always the Wagyu tasting was superb with the A5 reigning supreme. I love this place and have been going to is since we learned it was opening. I’ll continue going multiple times a year for as long as I can <3

Customer 39.Name: Eric
Customer 39.Content: Food and drinks were very good. Service was slow and with a couple of misses.

Customer 40.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 40.Content: I’m surprised no one has called the FBI ON these people. Everything was so good, it should be illegal. Also, the service we received from Megan and Phil was great. The precision and care of the preparing of the food over wood… was phenomenal. I’m willing to work just a little bit harder and longer, to take people who are special to me……There.

Customer 41.Name: Kashka
Customer 41.Content: I've been looking forward to this meal for a couple of years and it didn't disappoint.  The Niku team is fantastic and I really enjoyed the experience along with a fantastic meal.  I will absolutely go back.

Customer 42.Name: Caroline
Customer 42.Content: The staff, service and meal was outstanding. Definitely a special occasion experience.

Customer 43.Name: Andy
Customer 43.Content: The steaks were delicious, cooked to perfection. The service was also friendly and attentive. Overall we had a great time celebrating my wife’s birthday.

Customer 44.Name: Liz
Customer 44.Content: Excellent service, awesome food. Bone marrow was so good! We had a very great time. Would be nicer if the restaurant had a quieter atmosphere. Overall 9/10 definitely recommend!

Customer 45.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 45.Content: When you pay hundreds of dollars for top quality meat and it gets overcooked (visibly overcooked) and they shamelessly still serve it, it ruins the experience. This was one of my favorite restaurants, but not sure if I’ll go back.

Customer 46.Name: Mason
Customer 46.Content: The steak was exceptional and the service was delicate. The dining environment is also lovely with barely any noise at all.

Customer 47.Name: Casey
Customer 47.Content: We had a fabulous dinner celebrating a birthday! Highlight beyond the food itself was service, every single person was perfectly attentive, friendly, and great with allergies! Note to self, 2 people can split a steak, we ordered 2 steaks and it was too much food for us with sides and starters!

Customer 48.Name: Eric
Customer 48.Content: Best steaks in San Francisco. Great service and knowledgeable staff

Customer 49.Name: Davi
Customer 49.Content: Exceptional in every way. It’s pricey, but well worth it.

Customer 50.Name: Thomas
Customer 50.Content: Amazing food , loved the environment and the chefs selections

Customer 51.Name: Lawrence
Customer 51.Content: The best pig ears I have ever had; crispy and savory, reminiscent of pork rinds. Scallops with green goddess dressing were akin to ceviche freshly caught. The fried potato cubes were delightfully crispy on the edges and had a smooth flaky consistency, like finely scalloped potatoes. The Wagyu sampler was top three I have ever had; A5 and Takamori were the best. We will return to try other items!

Customer 52.Name: Zayra
Customer 52.Content: One of my best meals! The quality of the food and drinks are stellar. I can’t wait to eat here again.

Customer 53.Name: alex
Customer 53.Content: Absolutely fantastic. Great wine, great food, great staff, great vibe. But you pay for it!

Customer 54.Name: Hector
Customer 54.Content: Always a wonderful experience here. Looking forward to my next visit!

Customer 55.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 55.Content: had a great time food was amazing, would come back in the future, and service was amazing!!!!

Customer 56.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 56.Content: Amazing food and drinks. Staff was great, attentive and accommodating.  Can’t wait to go back.

Customer 57.Name: Anna
Customer 57.Content: It was our first time at Niku and it was a wonderful experience. Megan, our server, was super nice and so attentive. Simply the best! The food was great!  We had the bone marrow, scallops, 3x wagyu tasting, crispy potatoes, and broccoli. The A5 truly melts in your mouth! I try to stay away from carbs but the potatoes were irresistible. We had to go light on dessert so we had a scoop of chocolate bourbon ice cream and a scoop of mango sorbet - perfect! I recommend seating at the chef’s counter so you can watch them grill the meat and intricately plate the appetizers. Thank you Niku!

Customer 58.Name: Agnes
Customer 58.Content: Amazing food and service. I highly recommend sitting at the Chef’s counter to be in the middle of “all the action”!

Customer 59.Name: Rodrigo
Customer 59.Content:
This restaurant is great. Came in to celebrate my birthday and everything was on point. The meat is well cooked and high quality. Some of the pieces we ordered were the best I ever had.
Drink selection is also wide and good.
Bonus point for being a baby friendly restaurant!

Customer 60.Name: Melissa
Customer 60.Content: Everyone was just so sweet, coming by and wishing us a happy anniversary! The food was outstanding as usual!

Customer 61.Name: Elena
Customer 61.Content: Amazing dinner with truly such great service and attentiveness by everyone at Niku. The little touches really stood out. Definitely a great special occasion dinner.

Customer 62.Name: Cathy
Customer 62.Content: Incredibly fun meal and wildly delicious! Top ten for sure

Customer 63.Name: Yvonne
Customer 63.Content:
Everyone that works there are super helpful and nice.  Food is a bit expensive. Not only that u pay 6% SF mandate fee but u also pay tax on it too.
With that being said-6%+tax+tips on a $500+ meal is additional $120+++ eating out is way too expensive

Customer 64.Name: Ashley
Customer 64.Content: Absolutely delicious! I highly recommend sitting at the chefs table to watch the steaks and appetizers being prepared!

Customer 65.Name: LoriB
Customer 65.Content: Niku never disappoints!  By far the best steak restaurant in San Francisco.  Service is impeccable.

Customer 66.Name: Priz
Customer 66.Content: We loved it! We went to celebrate or anniversary and it was perfect!

Customer 67.Name: Colleen
Customer 67.Content:
The food was absolutely delicious. The service and ambiance were also very good.  Our server, Eric, provided a great overview of the different grades of wagyu that was greatly appreciated.
Prices were high as expected.  From our perspective this is definitely a special occasion destination.

Customer 68.Name: Erickson
Customer 68.Content: Excellent service and food.  Went there to celebrate a birthday and becoming newly re-employed. It was a great choice and would love to go back.

Customer 69.Name: Catalina E
Customer 69.Content: The experience was great overall, but the mocktails can improve. We ordered the Yuzu Shiso and Orange Cream. Both tasted well but had way too much ice. I felt like I paid for two glasses of ice with a hint of flavor. Otherwise the experience was high quality and we had a good time.

Customer 70.Name: Alexa
Customer 70.Content: Had a wonderful time celebrating my birthday here. The food was amazing and the service was exceptional.

Customer 71.Name: Hoho2701
Customer 71.Content: We are at the chef’s counter in front of the hearth. The ambience and service were top notch as everything was well explained and curated with proper pace. We got the Wagyu tasting and it was out of this world. And the somm paired with it a couple phenomenal reds from 2011.

Customer 72.Name: Nea Nicolle
Customer 72.Content: Sitting at the chef's counter was such a treat. This dinner reservation was a surprise for my husband as we celebrated our first year of being married. We were shook by the amazing service from everyone that helped us. They truly made us feel special especially with the complimentary glass of champagne. My husband loved it so much that he wants to return next year with the same exact seats. We're hoping we can return even sooner.

Customer 73.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 73.Content: 10/10 experience. We visited Niku to celebrate a birthday. Food was of quality and very delicious. Who we assume to be the head chef was friendly and it was great to watch the whole crew carefully craft our meals at the chefs counter. (Best seating in my opinion). My favorite was the potato crisp plate, and the tomahawk steak, and the wagyu meatball, and the charred broccolini (basically everything we had lol). We will be back again!

Customer 74.Name: Cindy
Customer 74.Content: Highly recommend getting the chefs counter seat. Watching the cooks was magical. The food was delicious and most importantly, the steaks were cooked CORRECTLY. I've always been a skeptic of steakhouses since majority of my steaks in the past has never been cooked right, but Niku has exceeded my expectations here. For them to be able to cook over a live flame is so incredibly impressive.

Customer 75.Name: Michael
Customer 75.Content: The steak is outstanding, and the smaller dishes are gorgeous and delicious as well. Great service!

Customer 76.Name: Kathleen
Customer 76.Content: Always excellent. We really enjoyed sitting at the chef's counter. All the food was generous and worth the star it's been awarded.

Customer 77.Name: ValentinD
Customer 77.Content: One of the best dinners I ever had. Great service. Food was phenomenal and selections of wines were exquisite. Will be back soon.

Customer 78.Name: karthi
Customer 78.Content:
went alone for a special occasion. 

arrived a bit early and no one was at the door to greet me. after a while, someone showed up and seated me at the bar while they prepared my table. I had a martini that wasn't cold enough. kinda set me on a course of wondering if the meal was going to live up to expectations, but tried to stay positive.

I was seated at the chef's counter, which was a fun experience. 

two major issues:

while the food was good overall, nothing I ate blew me away. the scallop dish was presented awkwardly on a half of a lime, kinda struck me as amateurish in appearance and the flavors didn't pop. tartare was very rich and decadent and the quality of the steak was excellent, but it was underseasoned.  the puffed rice accoutrement had gone a little soggy in storage. tsukune was good but wasn't anything to write home about. I had the a4 wagyu as my main. it was cooked nicely, but again, was underseasoned and perhaps it's nitpicking, but I wasn't crazy about the appearance of one of the two pieces. 

the other major issue was service. it seemed like no one was paying attention to me after I placed my order. I was lucky that I was able to flag down someone working at the pass repeatedly for various things, including a glass of wine that I had hoped to have when my steak arrived. I decided to eat most of it before that happened because I didn't want it to get cold while I waited. unfortunately, things like that happened a few times and along with issues with the food, I felt like things weren't up to the standards of a restaurant with the accolades it has received. 

unfortunately, I don't think I could strongly recommend niku to others, which is too bad because I  love japanese steakhouses and had high hopes.

Customer 79.Name: Matt
Customer 79.Content: Phenomenal meal. Can’t wait to come back. Perfect place for a celebration meal

Customer 80.Name: Joe
Customer 80.Content:
This place is the truth. Michelin star steakhouse slinging some of the highest quality beef on earth. What’s not to love? The drinks and other food items are spot on. Everything was so well done (except the steaks of course - those were medium rare :)

Also pro tip: sit at the chef’s counter if you’re a meathead. Might learn a thing or two watching and talking to the chefs.

Customer 81.Name: James
Customer 81.Content:
Difficult to give more well deserved praise than what one already reads in most of the reviews … but my table of 6 thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of this Michelin Star steakhouse . If I could  point out one minimal flaw for our night , it was the faux pas of trying to serve champagne in the wrong type of wine glass … quickly corrected however when pointed out but a restaurant of this stature  should  have known better  … minor issue .

Despite this , let me just otherwise give well deserved praise for the waitstaff… our main waiter was gracious , patient and always remained courteous on answering our questions .

We have dined here in past and for this very reason , we brought our out of town guests to enjoy a wonderful evening , Thank you again for a great service and we look forward to a future dining experience at Niku !

Customer 82.Name: Stuart
Customer 82.Content: wagyu tasting went stupid dumb hard and the filet was fire too

Customer 83.Name: Meghan
Customer 83.Content: From the moment of entering this restaurant and the talented staff exceeded all of our expectations!

Customer 84.Name: Pooya
Customer 84.Content: Not happy with the service, we asked for a specific table and they put us in the worst seat

Customer 85.Name: Viet
Customer 85.Content:
We had the Japanese Wagyu Tasting menu ( combination of A3,A4,A5 cuts ) , they were cooked to Medium rare
 A5 was melt in your mouth feel . A3 and A4 were equally great (my companion prefer A4 texture over A5 )  . It was a great new experience , much different than USDA Prime cut. Should be on Bucket list for all steak lovers

Customer 86.Name: RockfordV
Customer 86.Content: We loved our experience dining at Niku Steakhouse. We enjoyed everything we ordered and the service was great!

Customer 87.Name: Damon
Customer 87.Content: I had the best experience here. It was my birthday and the staff was super attentive and friendly. The food was amazing and I will definitely be back there. Thank you for such a lovely experience.

Customer 88.Name: Kristen
Customer 88.Content: We went here to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary and the service and food were outstanding!! So glad we went to Niku for our special occasion. The wait staff really went out of their way to make it special for us including a seat at the chef's counter, personalized card, champagne, and dessert! We were so happy with the way our food came out. Tomahawk Wagyu cooked to perfection, scallops, and bone marrow were all must haves! We also ordered broccolini and crispy potatoes on the side which were fabulous. It was pricey but worth it and you get a true Michelin star experience. Overall an amazing dinner and I would highly recommend it!!

Customer 89.Name: David
Customer 89.Content: Great. Will come back for sure. Delicious food and amazing staff. Thanks for a great first time. 👍🏼

Customer 90.Name: Becca
Customer 90.Content: Really excellent all around. We had the bone marrow and corn cappelletti appetizers and they were both excellent. Then we split a Wagyu tasting and it was phenomenal. Perfectly cooked and really well seasoned, as well as a carefully curated selection. For dessert we had the sorbet as after that much rich Wagyu we really needed something light and fresh - we had the strawberry and coconut and they were both delicious! The service was great, I appreciated that they were not hovering like at some Michelin starred restaurants - they were there when you needed them but not refilling my water after every sip.

Customer 91.Name: Shun
Customer 91.Content: The tomahawk was inedibly salty. I wouldn’t recommend it.

Customer 92.Name: Clark
Customer 92.Content: Unbelievable experience! Our server, Megan was outstanding, really helpful and totally guided us through the meal making it perfect. From the cocktails to food and with the wine paring, we enjoyed everything. Highly recommend Niku’s

Customer 93.Name: Christine
Customer 93.Content: We ordered for starters - the crispy pig ear and bone marrow.  As a group, we felt they were ok since it didn't seem like there was a lot of bone marrow.  For the mains, we ordered the tomahawk and short rib to share.  Both entrees came out really fatty, overly seasoned and the texture seemed really off.   The server was attentive at the beginning but did not come back to check on us after our meats arrived.  We will not return to this restaurant.

Customer 94.Name: Katheryn
Customer 94.Content: What an absolute treat! There is such pride and expertise in all that they create here. You feel it from the second you walk in. We were very impressed. Thank you for an excellent evening!

Customer 95.Name: Joseph
Customer 95.Content: Requested a table away from bathroom and high traffic area for a very important business dinner. Was sat behind a wine door and rights off the bar hallway. Everything else was good.

Customer 96.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 96.Content:
First time trying out this true Wagyu experience. Waiting staff was exceptional, took the time to guide us and educate us through the options and process of Wagyu choices, flavors and their origins.
We ended up with a custom wagyu tasting consisting of 1x A4 and 2x different A5 meats that was surprisingly expensive ($510)  but truly an awesome experience. To our beginner Wagyu palate, the A4 was our favorite. But before getting to that, the starters were alone worthy of their Michelin star. The creative quality of fresh flavors and textures brought together in the starters were worthy of a whole dining experience alone. Drinks selection, cocktails and Sake were also excellent. Highly recommended, will definitely plan on returning there to try the other options on the menu considering how good everything was.

Customer 97.Name: Michael
Customer 97.Content: Exceptional food and service. One of the very best modern steakhouses where the quality of ingredients and attention to detail make the experience truly memorable.

Customer 98.Name: queenbee533
Customer 98.Content: The best tomahawk steak I have ever had, tender, flavorful, cooked to perfection. Tartare and crispy pig ears were tasty starters. Attentive wait staff took care of every need. Cannot wait for another special occasion so I can return.

Customer 99.Name: DrFaisal
Customer 99.Content:
Food is amazing , you can understand why they have a michelin star
Everything else is average

Customer 100.Name: Robert
Customer 100.Content: Always a great choice for steak and a wonderful experience.

Customer 101.Name: Elizabeth
Customer 101.Content:
If I had not had the fish the food would have been outstanding. Thinking it was a Japanese steakhouse and we were sharing food, I thought the Sea Bass would be as delicious as the other dishes we ordered. Unfortunately the fish was rubbery and the skin was not crispy and the bed of risotto like(not memorable) was very bland.
Everything else was on point, from the service to the dessert.

Customer 102.Name: robert
Customer 102.Content: If you wish to know the différence between wagyu steak A3-A4-A5. This is the right place.  We were dissapointed with the taste of most of the starters we ordered (5). For us, they still need to improve the flavor they are offerring to make this adventure a great moment.

Customer 103.Name: Sydney
Customer 103.Content: Great food and wonderful service! It is definitely an experience. We enjoyed the knowledge of the staff when it came to the various types of wagyu. A great place to try a little bit of everything and share with your group.

Customer 104.Name: michael
Customer 104.Content: Service was impeccable!    Enjoyed the knowledge sharing and suggestions.

Customer 105.Name: ToanN
Customer 105.Content: The food was delicious and staff were very attentive.  Great dining experience!

Customer 106.Name: Mike
Customer 106.Content: Best filet mignon I’ve ever had! Service was exceptional and ambiance was on par with the best restaurants in the states. This steakhouse is well-deserving of their rank as the 21st best steakhouse in the country! A must-try if you are in San Francisco.

Customer 107.Name: Cedric
Customer 107.Content:
Niku ruined steak for my wife and I.
We celebrated our 15 year anniversary and Niku warmly welcomed us in with celebratory champagne and gratefulness for celebrating with them.
We had scallops and pig ears as starters and they really blew us away.
Our entree was the tasting of wagyu with a wine pairing, and sides of broccolini and their crispy potatoes.

Not going to describe the food because I cannot catch the experience in words.

Best restaurant we have been to so far.

Customer 108.Name: Joseph
Customer 108.Content: Really enjoyed our experience. The servers very attentive and informed. Enjoyed all of our dishes.

Customer 109.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 109.Content: Niku was absolutely amazing. My sig other and myself are foodies and we rated Niku one of the best experiences for food and service, even beats the French Laundry. They were personal, prompt and the food was amazing. Every time we finished a dish, a new one was out. We tried the tartare, scallops, ribeye, broccolini, potatoes, etc. All fabulous.

Customer 110.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 110.Content: Fun watching the open kitchen and steaks being prepared with such attention

Customer 111.Name: Westrad
Customer 111.Content: Food we ordered was excellent! We want to return to taste the tomahawk steak.

Customer 112.Name: LukeW
Customer 112.Content: Truly special dining experience! Not even close to cheap, but worth it. The Japanese Wagyu tasting and wine flight pairing was over the top, but the Australian Wagyu filet was our favorite. A perfect steak! Will definitely return.

Customer 113.Name: James
Customer 113.Content: It’s an excellent restaurant but what makes it a Michelin star restaurant I’m not certain. Yes there’s a gaucho grill and the meat is very good but I still had to wave down my server a few times. The steak is great but no better than several other spots. It’s not cheap but I suppose the quality justifies the price.

Customer 114.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 114.Content: Great food with great knowledgeable and friendly staff

Customer 115.Name: manny
Customer 115.Content: EVERYTHING was outstanding.  From the food to the service.  Very attentive and knowledgeable staff. Food was Delicious.

Customer 116.Name: Natalie
Customer 116.Content: Service was top notch, food exceeded my expectations! Great place for a special occasion

Customer 117.Name: mkimber
Customer 117.Content: Food was absolutely delicious and the service impeccable-

Customer 118.Name: Katie
Customer 118.Content:
Food and wine is excellent

Service is great we had a great time

Customer 119.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 119.Content: Dined at Niku for my partners birthday after hearing great things from a friend. The service and attention to detail was impeccable. We sat at the chefs counter (highly recommend!) and ordered the wagyu meatballs, corn tortelloni, broccolini, potatoes and the tomahawk. They made us feel welcomed, didn’t rush us, and were inquisitive and educational on the menu. We will most certainly be back! Cheers to Rebecca for making this experience extra special :)

Customer 120.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 120.Content: Food and staff were amazing! Especially if you haven't been to a nicer dining experience they were more than willing to help you figure out what to get!

Customer 121.Name: Leah
Customer 121.Content: The foods good but I don’t think worth the price. We had the A5 and I think ice had just as good steak for 1/3 the price.

Customer 122.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 122.Content: Awesome vibe at the chef’s table and great for date night.

Customer 123.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 123.Content: The greatest meal of my life! Expensive but worth every penny.

Customer 124.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 124.Content: This was one of the best experiences! The service was spectacular and the food, OMG! Can’t wait to go back !

Customer 125.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 125.Content: Outstanding food, great service, and ambiance, at a price...

Customer 126.Name: Deez
Customer 126.Content: Niku never disappoints. Their attention to detail is impeccable, the food is always amazing, and service is what other restaurants should model after. If Niku was not at the level it is, I would never consider driving the ~100 miles (one way) to dine there. And yet I've done it numerous times, for many special occasions.

Customer 127.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 127.Content: Every detail every bite was simply amazing. And incredible food experience, expensive and worth it.

Customer 128.Name: spreston
Customer 128.Content: Disappointing. We dined here before and had a great experience but this time, my boyfriend ordered a steak medium rare, it came out more rare and cold. It was his birthday, his Mom and  sister’s steaks came out med-rare, I guess 2 out of 3 is okay? The hostess said someone would reach out to us but 3 days later and we haven’t heard from anyone. I should have said something but he didn’t want to make a fuss and wait for another steak.  Interestingly - no one asked how the main course was. In hindsight, I tipped way too much - well, we just won’t be back.

Customer 129.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 129.Content: Niku is a wonderful place for beef. My first experience with waygu. Be prepared, it’s very rich but very tasty. Apps were great too. The fired maitake mushrooms were a favorite. If you want to impress someone, bring them here.

Customer 130.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 130.Content: New York strip was very good but Filet Mignon took it up a notch

Customer 131.Name: RobertM
Customer 131.Content:
The first thing you notice about Niku when you step into the dining room is that you feel as if you've been transported to a high-end steakhouse in Tokyo. The room is welcoming, and the ambiance is well-suited for your meal. The food is fantastic, well deserving of its Michelin 1-star rating. The starters are so incredible that you can make a meal without ordering any meat cuts. Standouts include the Hokkaido Scallops, tempura battered soft shell crab, corn-filled tortellini with black truffle shavings, and bone marrow with sort ribs and bordelaise sauce. I enjoyed the American Wagyu petite fillet minion with Wagyu fat potatoes and grilled mushrooms.
The wait staff members were polite, helpful, and professional.
An excellent dining experience!

Customer 132.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 132.Content: Amazing tasting flight of Kobe beef. Like nothing I've ever had

Customer 133.Name: YuYY
Customer 133.Content: I could give the service more than 5 stars if I could! Our servers were super attentive, friendly and helpful. I ordered a glass of wine but ended up didn’t like it, and our server offered to change to other wines and helped me find the one I liked.

Customer 134.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 134.Content: Las entradas están sobresalientes , la carne buena pero no espectacular.

Customer 135.Name: Gino505
Customer 135.Content: Food, service, atmosphere and Knowledge of the staff was phenomenal!!! It was a bit expensive, but this is a special occasion restaurant (or just don’t go crazy on wanting to try everything).

Customer 136.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 136.Content: they give handwritten notes, delicious food, tuck in your chair, etc. the little things add up to a truly exceptional dining experience

Customer 137.Name: TeddyR
Customer 137.Content: Amazing meal and unforgettable experience. We sat at the Chef’s table and watched the masters at work. Everyone was so lovely and attentive. And the food…A+++. Worth every Penny. It was our first time and will for sure not be our last.

Customer 138.Name: HienD
Customer 138.Content:
Service was excellent.
Appetizers were good: pig ears, gnudi.
Ribeye And Tomahawk were good, but not extraordinary.

Maybe I’ve been to so many steak places and am spoiled.

Customer 139.Name: Holidaymaker
Customer 139.Content: One of the best meals we have enjoyed in a long time, the food was simply excellent. The service was attentive and good humored without being over bearing. Certainly not a budget option but, but a great place to share dishes - especially the steaks! We left with big smiles on our faces and promise to be back!

Customer 140.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 140.Content: First time visit.  My family went for a birthday dinner for my two sons and we ordered family style for six.  Pig ears were unique and quite flavorful. Bone marrow had a rich flavor but not over powering.  For main course, the Tomahawk steak and Wagyu steak tasting plate.  Meats were flavorful and juicy not overcooked.  Choice of what type of steak knives to use was a pleasant treat and conversation piece.  Enough steak to feed us all, chef cut it to feed party of 6.  Enough for us without being overly full. Staff was attentive and knowledgeable.  Dining area isn't overly large but surprisingly it was not noisy and we were able to hear each other speak which is not true in some establishments.   Niku also carries Mora Estate wine which is both a refreshing wine and the bottles contain hand painted designs as an art piece.  Now on my list as a go.

Customer 141.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 141.Content: Niku is just hands down an amazing restaurant. So many times did I bite into something thinking "OMG!!!". My filet mignon was perfection, the oysters spectacular, the dungeness rice was out of this world, and the cocktails so yummy. The only time I ordered wrong was the artichokes, but hey, nobody is perfect! The menu is seriously craveable.

Customer 142.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 142.Content:
En general la comida estaba muy buena, sobre todo la charcuterie. Sin embargo, teniendo en cuenta el total de la experiencia, nos sorprendieron 2 cosas. La primera, que este restaurante pudiera tener estrella michelin, quizás porque quizás la valoración en US es diferente de la de España a la hora de seleccionar sus estrella michelin. La segunda, el precio tan elevado para el producto que ofrecen, sobre todo la manera de inflar los precios de las botellas de vino y el añadir en 6% en el ticket para el pago del seguro del trabajador, lo cual no entendimos.
A tener en cuenta aquí, que nosotros venimos de España, los precios para un restaurante así ya de base son 3 veces menos de lo que solemos pagar, pero en el caso que seas español, analiza muy bien el querer comer en este sitio porque no creo que este ticket de casi 400 dólares que pagamos merezca tanto la pena.

Customer 143.Name: Nicole
Customer 143.Content: One of my top 3 meals of my lifetime! From start to finish, from ambiance to attention to detail! Absolutely amazing!!!

Customer 144.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 144.Content: Got the $375 wagyu tasting. Water/drink refills were fast but food / bill took 20+ minutes to order/get check. A3/4 wagyu were okay. I ordered med-well and the A5 they gave me was basically raw and chewy, extremely red. Was crammed shoulder to shoulder at chefs bar and had waitresses and patrons bumping into me every few minutes. Guy next to me was watching a YouTube video with headphones on. Doesn’t really fit the vibe of a $400 steak place

Customer 145.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 145.Content: Absolutely amazing! The food was delicious, the ambience was great, and the staff went above and beyond to make my fiancés birthday memorable.

Customer 146.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 146.Content: Sitting at the bar by the grill created a fun experience and the chefs were engaging. Food was incredible and overall experience was worth the added value you pay for a resturant at such a high caliber. Mushrooms and potato were as good as the steak!

Customer 147.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 147.Content:
We came in for our 9th anniversary and was really excited! We got quite a few complimentary items - sparkling to celebrate, a cheese cracker of some sort, a chocolate cake and some sort of Oreo-like cookie. All delish!

We ordered glass a red wine each to pair with our Japanese wagyu tasting and ordered two sides: crab rice and crispy potatoes.

Whenever I didn’t anywhere I am super observant and with Niku’s reputation, I expected a lot out for he quality of the food and the service. I noticed that when other parties order sides, everything came out all at once when their steak was ready. When our tasting menu was delivered it came with the crab rice. I thought surely the crispy potatoes would come soon after. We waited maybe 20-30mins before we follow up. The potatoes came 5 mins later. They comped this item since it came late.

Overall, I’d say the food was really good! The a5 9oz tasting was the perfect amount for my fiance and I. The a5 was soo rich that just a small amount was more than enough.

We are definitely coming back. We wanna try the rib and the tomahawk next!

Customer 148.Name: LoriJ
Customer 148.Content: Unbelievable food, service & ambiance. Pricey but worth it for a celebratory dinner. Highly recommend.

Customer 149.Name: foodie
Customer 149.Content: A wonderful evening celebrating 35th Anniversay and a grandson’s college graduation. The staff was attentive and welcoming. Nice touches of complimentary champagne to help start the evening. The Tare Tare, Pig Ears, and Marrow were terrific. No surprises the steaks were as they should be from a top-rated establishment. Highly recommended for special occasions.

Customer 150.Name: dafster
Customer 150.Content: Service was slow and lackadaisical. Particularly the bar. Rib eye steak was really fatty, beyond reasonable. And all a little too mediocre to justify the pricing. And ridiculously high corkage.

Customer 151.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 151.Content: Always spectacular, always worth the money, always worth my time.

Customer 152.Name: Chris
Customer 152.Content: Daniel was amazing! The food and service were outstanding.

Customer 153.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 153.Content:
A little pricey but very good
Corkage fee too high 80 $$$???

Customer 154.Name: MarkM
Customer 154.Content:
This is the last hi end Steakhouse I needed to experience to see if it lived up to its Hype!
For the money $$$, this would place definitely didn’t live up to all the Hype about it! Drinks 🍸were very good but small! Service was excellent!
As was the Ambiance!! Food wasn’t quite up to hi end standards tho! Drinks 🍸Appetizers, Entree’s 
And desserts were $400! For half that price you could go to Harris Ranch Steakhouse and get more food  plus excellent Service & Ambiance!!
This is a One & Done type of restaurant! I can always say that I have been there!!

Customer 155.Name: BretB
Customer 155.Content: Amazing! From the moment we sat down to the moment we left, everything was perfect. Best birth celebration ever

Customer 156.Name: tominsf
Customer 156.Content: Always good service although they do appear to be slipping a bit from past visits. Staff is not as polished as before and it took a long time to get cocktails at our table. Steaks re perfectly done. Appetizers and sides are hit or miss they don’t have any that seem to be their forte.

Customer 157.Name: Arnold
Customer 157.Content:
Certainly! Here's a sample review:

---

I recently dined at Niku, and I must say, it was an outstanding experience from start to finish. The steaks were nothing short of perfection—juicy, tender, and bursting with flavor. The seasoning was spot-on, and the steaks were cooked to the exact temperature requested. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable, providing excellent recommendations and ensuring that our needs were met promptly and with a smile. They went above and beyond to make our dining experience memorable, striking the perfect balance between professionalism and friendliness. I highly recommend it to anyone looking to enjoy top-notch steaks and exemplary service.

---

Customer 158.Name: Tammy
Customer 158.Content:
Service was excellent!!

My steak was way too fat though

Customer 159.Name: nocilantro
Customer 159.Content:
Food didn’t seem quite as memorable the second time around. The layers of potato were still great but the meat wasn’t as tender and marvelous as I’d remembered.

I used Inkind to pay which turned into a nightmare of an ordeal. I entered the table number instead of the check number and by chance ended up paying a bill that was within $10 of ours. I got called after leaving the restaurant to try to fix the error. Although I offered to just pay the difference on the bill (which seemed the easiest way to resolve the problem and not take up too much of anyone’s time), they insisted on completely reversing out the bill (ie, the payment of the bill via Inkind plus the payment via credit card for the tip on the subpar service we received) and charging everything anew. I said with no uncertainty to our server that if I ended up with double the charge because the first didn’t actually end up reversing that I would be extremely upset and he swore to me up and down that it wouldn’t be the case, that the manager took care of it.

Fast forward a week later when the charges are still there (both of them) and I contact Inkind directly to resolve the issue. They tell me that it (what the manager did) wouldn’t have worked because I don’t have a specific house account with that restaurant. Whoopee. So, I eventually got my first charge reversed, but not by the restaurant, who seemed to have no problem keeping me waiting for an extra 15-20 minutes while they “handled” the problem. This totally unsavory, non-customer friendly interaction, in addition to the so-so culinary experience, kills any desire I might have to visit this place again. Food wasn’t worth the price and the service was far from even being amiable.

Customer 160.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 160.Content: Came here for Mother’s Day.  The service was great and the food was very good.

Customer 161.Name: DawnM
Customer 161.Content:
Where do I begin? Our family's dining experience at Niku was amazing. From the staff right down to the music that was playing in the background, everything was top-tier! The food! The food was amazing! The Little Gem Salad with the Green Goddess Dressing was so delicious. The dressing is amazing, and if it was proper, I would have licked the bowl, lol. Beef Tartare with Puffed Rice is a must, and the Bone Marrow was flavorful and delicious.

We were a party of four, so we ordered a 60-ounce Tomahawk Wagyu Steak grilled medium over the open flame with Dungeness Crab Rice, Crispy Potatoes, and Green Asparagus Katsu with Lemon Posset for dessert. I have zero complaints. This was the first time, in a long time, I've had an amazing meal from start to finish. If you are able, this display of culinary excellence is a must and should be experienced by any self-declared foodie.

Customer 162.Name: PatBateman
Customer 162.Content: I was expecting much more from a hyped one Michelin star restaurant. Super noisy, uncomfortable seats, lousy service and mediocre food. Would not go again.

Customer 163.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 163.Content:
Overall great experience. I do wish they have more of an entry way as the hostess was busy when we arrived and there were several other parties waiting so we were all crammed in the doorway essentially waiting for her to return. 

Service was great. Most of the food was very good, espeically any of the meat and steaks dishes which is good since this is a steakhouse. Some of the sides and desserts were a little underwhelming and the other reason I cannot give five stars for the food. But the apps and the mains were delicious and great. Would definitely come back and recomment to others if they're looking for a nice meal on the higher end.

Customer 164.Name: JanVincent
Customer 164.Content:
This was my second visit to Niku and once again it did not disappoint. Realistically the only disappointment is just how expensive things are, but this is true of San Francisco in general. Either way, dining at Niku is always fulfilling and I certainly enjoy sitting at the chef's counter. Being able to interact with the chef and ask questions is worth the visit alone. The food here honestly comes second to that level of access for me. 

The food itself was delicious and on this visit I decided to skip the traditional steaks and had the short rib. I slightly regret this decision as the short rib, while it tasted great, was super rich and did not give me that satiated feeling I was looking for. I would still order it again in the future. Fortunately the other dishes I ordered helped me reach that fulfillment I was seeking.

The best part about dining at Niku is the service. Every single person working in this restaurant is welcoming, warm, and very personable. They were all very easy to talk to and did not come off as pretentious like in some other high end restaurants. The people and the service they provided are why I came back and will continue to come back.

There is a caveat however to eating at the Chef's counter. It's very tight sitting there and you are definitely having dinner with the other guests sitting beside you. If you are ok with literally sitting shoulder to shoulder with strangers then you will enjoy this experience. However, if you want a more intimate setting then skip the counter.

Customer 165.Name: EFool
Customer 165.Content: The steak was only warm when it came and the hot plate was not hot.  Otherwise the food taste good and service was good

Customer 166.Name: Chua
Customer 166.Content:
Made a reservation for 4 for a weekend dinner at 7pm. Restaurant was a little packed but well spaced between tables. Service staff were very polite and helpful (I asked where to park and one staff by the  literally walked out to show me where I can do so).

Ordered a number of dishes, asparagus, bone marrow, tomahawk, risotto, house rolls, crispy potatoes, and desserts and all of us were stuffed (substantial amt for 4 pax). Pity the beef tartare was out when we were actually excited to try that when we were there (so do go and order that early).

Ambiance was nice, though a little loud, but we were still able to conversen without shouting within our group.

Meal set us back close to $500, steep I would say, but food and service was overall good!

Customer 167.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 167.Content: Restaurant is just hype. Digital creator must be good. First time I had that white chewy part (gristle??) on a $115+ ribeye steak among other $$$$ restaurants. Rock Cod is mushy and risotto had undercooked grains. Service is subpar.

Customer 168.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 168.Content: Service and food were fantastic. Meat was cooked perfectly.

Customer 169.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 169.Content: Wonderfull dining experience.  Did family style and the reccommendations by the serving staff were on point.  They didn't just pick the pricest items they truly gave honest reccomendations.

Customer 170.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 170.Content: Eric is the best server I've ever had- all time epic menu rundown. Food, service, ambiance was exceptional.

Customer 171.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 171.Content: Great place to be at atmosphere was mellow.  Service and restaurant workers were very friendly

Customer 172.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 172.Content: Best steak ever . Top rated service . Meal was prepared and cooked in front of us . Will definitely return

Customer 173.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 173.Content: Had a wonderful evening at Niku steakhouse. Took my mum for her bday because she loves steak and she had a great time! She said she wants to come back every year for her bday. We started with wine, bone marrow, and oysters it was delicious! My mom got her favorite filet and I opted for the cod fish. We both loved our mains! We shared potatoes and the asparagus both were amazing. Ended with lemon something dessert also amazing and a French press. We sat at the chefs table which I highly recommend!! They answer all your questions and have outstanding service. Salty was the best ( real name is Celtic) he described the different cuts of steak for my mum. Overall highly recommend!!! And we will be back :)

Customer 174.Name: Delish
Customer 174.Content:
LOVE this place. Our first time here and the  service was wonderful! The staff are so professional, kind and the food is delicious! Came for my father's birthday and it did not disappoint. From the moment we arrived, they wished my father a HBD, then promptly seated us in the perfect spot. Our main waiter was delightful and made the best recommendations from wine to how much to order. From the amuse bouche to the complimentary passion fruit cream puffs at the end, as each of the wait staff came with our next dish, they presented beautifully prepared, artfully arranged dishes-all tasty.
We ordered the gorgeous gem salads, soft shell crab, asparagus, crispy potato cubes, NY steaks,
rib eye, parker house rolls and finished with refreshing sorbets.
My heartfelt thanks to the incredible staff who work tirelessly and seamlessly to make the experience so fantastic. They were accommodating, attentive and thoughtful with their beautifully handwritten birthday note, the perfect menu and adding a candle to my father’s dessert making for a very special evening. If you're planning a special dinner or are just in the mood for a great steakhouse and drinks this is it!

Customer 175.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 175.Content:
For how expensive the American  Wagyu tomahawks was, it was not that good. I would rather go to the Blind Butcher if you want quality steak for a reasonable price. ￼
For an upscale restaurant, they charge a $8/slice cake cutting fee if you brought a birthday cake. Probably wouldn’t go back.

Customer 176.Name: TimH
Customer 176.Content: Incredible dining experience. Highly recommend going! Everything we ate was delicious and service was awesome.

Customer 177.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 177.Content:
Starters are all good, highly recommend pig ear
Good service and unique open kitchen

Customer 178.Name: Anastasia
Customer 178.Content: Not worth it, too pretentious, service is meh, only good  food there is wagyu, everything else is overpriced and tasteless

Customer 179.Name: Jessica
Customer 179.Content: Made a reservation for 8:30pm but did not get seated until 8:45pm. The girl who checked us in initially also did not remember us within 15 minutes and asked us again if we checked in with her manager. A3 wagyu was mediocre and so fatty.

Customer 180.Name: TMoney
Customer 180.Content: Steak was good. Sides were unremarkable. Value was low for price point.

Customer 181.Name: Nicole
Customer 181.Content: Great dining experience. The food and service were superb.

Customer 182.Name: DanT
Customer 182.Content:
The food is really good.
But we had disjointed service.
The apps came fairly quickly, but we waited over an hour for the steak entree to arrive.  And one side came 15 min after the steak.
Not sure if kitchen was short staffed.
Servers were very nice…but no acknowledgment of delayed food.

Customer 183.Name: Cayla
Customer 183.Content: The service and food was phenomenal.  A bit pricey but definitely perfect for a special occasion. My partner enjoyed celebrating his birthday here & the staff made him feel extra special!

Customer 184.Name: StephenT
Customer 184.Content:
We had a wonderful dinner at Niku. Excellent services. Awesome food.
Definitely will revisit again, and again.

Customer 185.Name: Aimee
Customer 185.Content: Outstanding service throughout! Food was good and creative but not what we’d expect from one star.

Customer 186.Name: Nossa1
Customer 186.Content: Amazing!!! We haven’t such an amazing meal/experience like that in a long time! Thank you, Niku! We will be back!

Customer 187.Name: happywifey
Customer 187.Content: If you love wagyu then you need to eat here. They know what they're doing with the food. We had the tomahawk and the A5 sampler which was outstanding. Service was great and we sat at the chef station bar seating area which was fun watching them cooking. Service changed after we finished our meal. We waited about 1/2 hour til we got antsy to leave. My husband was waving his hand every time someone kinda glanced our way but to no avail. We had a waiter but he was off tending to many things. I'd say it's due to poor management. If you're a well run restaurant you have someone (usually a manager) who makes sure the diners are all being taken care of and we saw no such thing. The front of the bar seating area was doted on but we sat on the side area and were abandoned. Don't get seated there, anywhere else would have been stellar service from start to finish!

Customer 188.Name: LouisK
Customer 188.Content:
Amazing food and its balance.
Warm service! Too expensive wine list.

Customer 189.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 189.Content: Hands down my favorite steak house in San Francisco.

Customer 190.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 190.Content: Our first experience eating here. Service, atmosphere was top notch. For our meal, the wagyu tsukune to start with was wonderful. For main course, my wife had the cod, and I went with the dry-aged New York strip, we added the potatoes, miatake mushrooms and Parker house rolls. Everything was delicious, my only regret was not going with the wagyu. Although the NY strips flavor was nice, it turned out to be rather chewy for dry-aged beef. We’ll definitely go back, but I’ll avoid the NY strip next time and go with the wagyu.

Customer 191.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 191.Content: Amazing food and th cuality of the meat is outstanding

Customer 192.Name: Maggie
Customer 192.Content: I took my boyfriend to Niku for his birthday. We ordered a $265 wagyu tomahawk steak. It was very delicious but we couldn’t finish all 48 oz of it. We asked our waiter to box up all of it up, bone included. There was so much meat left on it. When we got home there were 2 small pieces packed. Probably $50+ meat missing plus wagyu tallow that we planned on eating. I was at a complete loss. I feel like we wasted all of our money and had half our food stolen. Sadly a terrible birthday for him. I’d avoid this place.

Customer 193.Name: alevt
Customer 193.Content: When we got to the restaurant we waited for some time until we were seated.I sort of expected at least receiving curtesy drinks or a sort of apology for the wait.Otherwise everything was outstanding .Always recommend the place.

Customer 194.Name: ILoveFood
Customer 194.Content: I want more! Food was outstanding, presentation was spot on. The service and staff were fun, modern, professional but not stuffy. The restaurant decor is beautiful, elegant, but again, not stuffy. Great vibe and every dish we ordered was loved by all in our party. Highly recommend this restaurant for any special occasion, to impress a date, or just to treat oneself. Will definitely be coming back.

Customer 195.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 195.Content:
The A5 was underwhelming.
The place was TOO LOUD!
I had to yell to be heard.
The rest of the food was excellent!

Customer 196.Name: ValeC
Customer 196.Content: Simplemente fantástico! Pedimos un platillo con los 3 tipos de Wagyu A3, A4 y A5 y fue súper delicioso. Imperdible

Customer 197.Name: Kayb
Customer 197.Content: Absolutely fabulous from start to finish. We were elated in the private wine room and while the open flame chef counter seating seems interesting. The volume in the main dining area is loud. We loved the wine tasting room. Had a fabulous French white to start then a bold amazing amarone with our steaks. Our group of four tried the oysters, mussels and bone marrow. Bone marrow was like spreading butter on sourdough with short ribs. So good. The fermented tomato and shishito topped busters were also amazing. Nothing tops the steaks. We didn’t tasting of the a3, a4 and a5 wagyus, the 48 oz tomahawk which they do Pittsburgh style and the 44 farms ribeye. All were outstandingly cooked and. Some of the.best steaks we have ever eaten. The amuse bouches served by the chef were also good. Papaya cream puffs and an avocado cream toasts. We ordered the apple hibiscus sorbet and it was the perfect palate cleanser. The staff from start to end were wonderful. Definitely pricy but well worth it for a special occasion.

Customer 198.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 198.Content: The food was amazing, especially the crispy pig ears, crispy potatoes, bread rolls and fresh wasabi! My friends and I ordered the Japanese A5 tasting and it was super pricey (~$300) for 8 small pieces of wagyu (there were four of us, so we only had 2 pieces each). We thought there was going to be more than one plate but that was it. We also ordered the beef tartare and that was refreshing! First time having airy fried tendon! Very unique! The bone marrow was okay, a bit too much sauce for me. My friend asked for more sliced bread but our waiter declined. The overall service was okay, could be better. We also ordered the tomahawk which is more worth it than the Japanese A5 tasting. Wagyu brownie and the fruity tart was a great way to end the meal! I would go here again for the unique appetizers and desserts. For Japanese A5 wagyu, I would go to Yazawa or Yakiya (great quality/quantity for a decent price, also better service).

Customer 199.Name: MandyG
Customer 199.Content: Always a great experience at Niku. Excellent service and food is always great! My must orders are bone marrow, crispy potato’s, and tomahawk!

Customer 200.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 200.Content: Food was good. Service was off, but they fixed everything that went wrong. It’s a loud industrial space with a loud sound track, so that experience and setting was much different than what comes to mind when I think of a steakhouse.

Customer 201.Name: hermanp
Customer 201.Content: One the best in life!! Can’t rave enough!!fabulous fantastic

Customer 202.Name: JodiAnnS
Customer 202.Content: Had an amazing dinner and night here the food was exquisite. We had the tomahawk steak it was perfect!!!

Customer 203.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 203.Content: Perfect , we really enjoy the food so much, the beef was fantastic

Customer 204.Name: AJFish
Customer 204.Content: Strong, if not quite impeccable service, good ambiance. The excellent staff and stellar food push it over the top though. The menu isn't overly complicated, but everything was executed extremely well, with exceptional care and attention to detail. The ingredient choices are thoughtful, timely, and combined insightfully to highlight multiple elements in every dish. Bravo, Niku!

Customer 205.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 205.Content: The dining experience is top notch. The food is delicious and the entire staff is very friendly, warm, and welcoming.  We’ve been here twice now and each time it’s been an amazing experience. Thank you, Niku!

Customer 206.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 206.Content: High quality wagyu with great service. Nothing else needed. This is our favorite steak place.

Customer 207.Name: jessicat
Customer 207.Content: Spent 600$ for two people. Food was excellent but service was not great. The host ( Ellis I believe ) was the best and super nice! He went above and beyond. Had to wait a very long time for drinks and had to pour our own wine throughout meal. Just not what I would expect for Michelin star restaurant. Wouldn’t go back and it’s a shame because the food was really good.

Customer 208.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 208.Content: Good food, service and ambiance. We tried the tomahawk, tasting for A5s, bread, potato, and mushroom in the past. Everything we tried was good, but i highly recommend the potatoes if its your first time. Steaks are excellent here. I would recommend getting the tomahawk, medium rare or rare. I ordered medium and it was a bit dry for my taste at medium heat. If you have a good apetite tasting menu needs to be supplemented with some starters. The restaurant has clean facilities. Bar does a good with cocktails and has a good selection of wines, but no beers on tap.

Customer 209.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 209.Content: Best steakhouse and service I had in my life ! Tastes from all around the world cooked to perfection. We took his famous wagyu A3,4&5 and additional rib eye and new york cut. Thank you chef Niku for an unforgettable experience. It was so good I took meat from their butchery next door home to cook the following day :) I would definitely recommend anyone to stop and taste from Nikus experience.

Customer 210.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 210.Content: A lovely ambience accompanied with an enjoyable view at the counter seating. The A5 tasting was the highlight for me. Wonderful drinks, service, and food made it a meal I never wanted to end.

Customer 211.Name: Abby
Customer 211.Content:
One of the best places to try Wagyu! 

I ordered the wagyu tasting platter, best best best idea ever. They have a 6oz platter and a 9oz platter. I ordered the 9oz which include A3, A4, and A5 wagyu, tasting the different flavors and how it melts in your mouth was just perfect!

There was also a side order of the cabbage, forgot the name but it was creamy, not too rich and went very well with my steaks.

Definitely worth every penny spent~

Customer 212.Name: JulesP
Customer 212.Content: Very disappointing service experience from the restaurant. The staff weren't attentive at all.

Customer 213.Name: Zhouster
Customer 213.Content: Awesome staff! Very accommodating and willing to answer any and all questions. Food was delicious - really liked the A4 and A5, as well as the Australian wagyu. Very solid old fashioned as well.

Customer 214.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 214.Content: Great experience! I will for sure come back for more. This was by far the best steak house I've been to in California.

Customer 215.Name: flamingo
Customer 215.Content: Not what I expected from a Michelin star restaurant. Rib eye we ordered was almost inedible. Mainly fat. The waiters did not seem to be happy to be there. When we asked for a description of the meats, the waiter was unable to provide any info that wasn't already on the menu. Extremely underwhelming and overpriced.

Customer 216.Name: aliK
Customer 216.Content: The music did NOT match the sophisticated level of the food. The songs were like a playlist for a hip diner.

Customer 217.Name: Sylz
Customer 217.Content: This place was my favorite new fancy restaurant in SF! It’s located in the design district right across from the old Zinga building. The vibe was pretty fancy and dark, very intimate small spot. I ordered the bone marrow, the pickled vegetables, the oysters and the 6 oz filet. The steak was honestly the best steak I’ve ever had! It was nice and crispy on the outside and soft and flavorful inside! It’s a Michelin star restaurant which I didn’t know when we booked. I wish I had dressed up a little bit more. I felt a little underdressed with my skirt and sweater. The vibe was very hip and younger, playing Dr. Dre and Tupac! It was definitely a modern fancy restaurant and I want to go back!

Customer 218.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 218.Content: Comida y servicio excelente! Sin duda regresaría!!

Customer 219.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 219.Content: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful first time experience at Niku last night and enjoyed every moment sitting at the chef’s table. Every morsel of food was delectable!! We can’t wait for our next visit.

Customer 220.Name: Great
Customer 220.Content: Excellent food and excellent service. But not inexpensive

Customer 221.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 221.Content:
From the moment we stepped into the restaurant, we were immersed in an exceptional dining experience that surpassed all expectations. The service was outstanding, with our server, demonstrating remarkable knowledge of the menu, offering personalized recommendations that greatly enhanced our meal. The ambience of the restaurants struck the perfect balance between elegance and comfort, setting the stage for a memorable evening.

The culinary offerings were nothing short of divine. Each starter inside dish was a delightful exploration of flavors, perfectly executed and presented. However, the highlight of our meal was undoubtedly the Waggy tomahawk. This exquisite dish, recommended for sharing, was a mass class in quality and taste, making it an absolute must try for any visitor. ￼￼

I cannot recommend this restaurant, highly enough. Whether it’s for the impeccable service, the atmosphere, setting, or the culinary excellence, it promises an unforgettable dining experience. A visit here is a journey through the best of what fine dining has to offer. ￼

Customer 222.Name: Sancho
Customer 222.Content: Fantastic experience. Great food, awesome service. 10/10 would come again

Customer 223.Name: NicholasF
Customer 223.Content: We had an exceptional dining experience.  The cocktails were perfect, the food was sublime and the wine pairing was perfect.  Chris, our waiter, offered exemplary service.

Customer 224.Name: VanP
Customer 224.Content: Delicious foods, can’t wait to come back to try the a5! And thank you for making us feel special on our anniversary :)

Customer 225.Name: x5115
Customer 225.Content: Awesome food and service! Best steak in S.F.! Great drinks.

Customer 226.Name: taubles
Customer 226.Content: Such a great experience at Niku! All the things I love about a well-run, well managed restaurant were in place here such as fantastic food, superb service without being too overt, a great wine list and to my extreme surprise, very moderate noise level so you could actually enjoy conversing with your dinner partners even with close to a full house. This was a belated birthday dinner given to me by my boss and I couldn't be happier that I chose Niku as my destination - checked all my boxes!!

Customer 227.Name: scott
Customer 227.Content: wonderful experience -- the team at Niku deliver at a very high level -- looking forward to my next visit

Customer 228.Name: JonathanL
Customer 228.Content: Fantastic meal at Niku as always. It's the only steakhouse in SF that puts just as much thought and care into their appetizers, sides, and desserts as their protein. Chefs Dustin and Celtin and Eric led a phenomenal experience for us!

Customer 229.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 229.Content: This steakhouse was awesome! The steak was very good, and the apps / sides were AMAzing. They started us off with some complimentary finger food (a spin on avocado toast, which was DELICIOUS). We ordered the capitelli and the wagyu tsukune- both absolutely wonderful. For main course we ordered the NY strip - very well cooked, i just wish it had a liiiittle more flavor. On the side we got the potatoes (the miso dipping sauce is amazing), and the parker house rolls. For two people we were FULL. Very good value. Would definitely go back!

Customer 230.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 230.Content:
They brought out a candle and cake for my date I really appreciated that!

Food came on time and was amazing

Drinks were great!

Customer 231.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 231.Content: Incredible! The food was delicious and the wine was great! I loved the wagyu

Customer 232.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 232.Content: Niku Steakhouse was AMAZING!!! I took my boyfriend here for his birthday and it did not disappoint. He loves cooking steak and seeing how it’s cooked so the chefs counter was the perfect seating area for us. The food was incredible and the service was amazing. We’re planning to come back soon because we didn’t try enough of the sides!

Customer 233.Name: JoyceL
Customer 233.Content: The food was good but not Michelin caliber in my opinion. Service was slow and one side dishes was cold by the time we received it at the table.

Customer 234.Name: AndreaC
Customer 234.Content:
Niku is a a truly incredible restaurant, with a few glitches.  We had an amazingly warm greeting and were so excited for our first visit, to celebrate a family birthday.  Unfortunately our 9:15 reservation was not honored on time, understandably because the party before us sat longer than planned.  But the 6 of us were packed into a sliver of a standing waiting area for 30 minutes before the decision was taken to offer us an upgrade to the private room, as it was not booked and the other table didn’t get up.  What was strange about this was that for 30 minutes waiting, we weren’t even offered a drink while we waited, and the private room could’ve been offered considerably earlier, as it was empty.

Once we were seated at 9:45, we had a truly wonderful time.  Our server Chris was exceptional, as were the other staff members.  We were brought some complementary items, and clearly there was a big effort to provide us a wonderful experience.  THE FOOD was incredibly delicious and my cocktail was interesting and light as air.  The steaks were out if this world, and will certainly be calling us back.  The sides were also wonderful, as was the salad.  The desserts didn’t blow us away as much as the rest of the meal, but the toasted rice ice cream and brownie stood stronger than the rest.  Overall our experience was exceptional, with the exception of our wait time and experience.  We will definitely come again and loved so much about it.

Customer 235.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 235.Content: The servers were literally taking all our plates and bowls away without asking and without us finishing our courses. Super bad service

Customer 236.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 236.Content: Niku is hands down the best steak in town. Never disappoints and always delivers a wonderful experience. The staffs’ friendliness and knowledge are arguably the best in the Bay Area. The extent to which this restaurant goes to, to provide the most unique menu items is absolutely amazing. We are always impressed with the creative techniques they come up with to utilize all the yummy parts of their ingredients.

Customer 237.Name: JNguyen
Customer 237.Content:
I would definately give Niku a try if you haven't been here before. The service from the team was very helpful and set the tone from the get go.

Be expected to spend a decent amount here. From appitizers to the main entree things were fairly priced and expected of a steakhouse.

Customer 238.Name: Shan
Customer 238.Content: Phenomenal. You won’t be disappointed. Service is amazing. The food is delicious & adventurous.

Customer 239.Name: Baybee
Customer 239.Content: I celebrated my birthday dinner. The service was top notch but the rib eye steak was mediocre it was tough and nothing to brag about. Considering they are a steakhouse I expected more on the quality of their steaks.

Customer 240.Name: RobinR
Customer 240.Content: Excellent food and even better staff. Franco is master drink maker

Customer 241.Name: Bfoll
Customer 241.Content: Not cheap, but well worth it! Everything was on point.

Customer 242.Name: JessStr
Customer 242.Content: An amazing dinner with the most personable staff. Thank you!

Customer 243.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 243.Content: Would recommend to anyone celebrating a special occasion

Customer 244.Name: OpenTable Diner
