Customer 244.Content: This was our second visit at Niku, celebrating our anniversary. The service is top notch and the food is AMAZING!! Rebekah, manager, has taken care of us both times and truly knows how to make each visit feel special! THANK YOU, NIKU!

Customer 245.Name: nailee
Customer 245.Content: The food was just ok. Nothing WOW about it for the price of the tomahawk.

Customer 246.Name: Moira
Customer 246.Content: Superb customer service! Highly recommend this place if you’re celebrating something special. The amount of detail and care that went into this experience was unmatched! The food was amazing -steak was cooked perfectly and do not get me started on how excellent the side dishes and dessert was. I will definitely be back. My only qualm is that I wish we knew about this place sooner!

Customer 247.Name: ChrisM
Customer 247.Content: Second trip here. First time blew my mind. This last time was just ok. Steak was overcooked and under seasoned. No one came up at that point of the meal to check that things were to our liking. Incredible quality of meat, but for $100+ for a US steak, I'd hope the temperature would be closer to what I ordered (MR, but a good piece of the steak was just light pink).

Customer 248.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 248.Content: As good as ever! We had an outstanding experience from start to finish, kudos to the entire team for making our date night extra special.

Customer 249.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 249.Content: Amazing service, amazing food!! We had the best time celebrating a birthday here. Shoutout to the great staff for taking such good care of us!

Customer 250.Name: Hunter
Customer 250.Content: Great experience sitting at the chefs counter. Go see Ian and he’ll be sure you get a great dining experience.

Customer 251.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 251.Content:
Meat overcooked, service was okay, initially was bad.

Not worthy of a Michelin star at all.

Customer 252.Name: PatrickW
Customer 252.Content: The food is delicious, the service is outstanding, the decor is beautiful, the attention to detail in everything is excellent. Every visit is a joy.

Customer 253.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 253.Content: Wonderful, loved the food. My boyfriend enjoyed the experience and had a great birthday!

Customer 254.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 254.Content: Amazing food and experience. They take high level cuisine to another level

Customer 255.Name: BenedictA
Customer 255.Content: Excellent experience.  We had a party of 5 people to celebrate a birthday milestone.  Niku Steakhouse did not disappoint!  Service was excellent throughout the evening.  We had their rib eye, filet mignon, and flat steak and they were served to perfection.  Their appetizers were tasty.  Two of our favorites were the crispy potatoes and the pig ears.  Overall a nice vibe with excellent background music.  Recommend!

Customer 256.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 256.Content: Food was wonderful, the service complimented and elevated the whole experience.  Celebrated my son’s 20th birthday and I appreciated the little touches that were added; the birthday card and the complimentary dessert for the birthday boy AND the rest of our party of 4.

Customer 257.Name: anon
Customer 257.Content: Everything about this restaurant is superb except for the astronomical prices.

Customer 258.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 258.Content: Best service ever! Everyone was so polite. The food was amazing! Chicken dumplings and bone marrow for appetizers is a must! Ribeye was top tier!

Customer 259.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 259.Content: Excelente lugar para cenar. La carne deliciosa perfectamente cocinada. Los sides muy buenos y los ostiones de entrada magnificos.

Customer 260.Name: AliceM
Customer 260.Content: We had a wonderful birthday celebration! Food is great and they made it super special :)

Customer 261.Name: Elsie
Customer 261.Content: I have mixed feelings about this.  I took friends who wanted to go, including a family member who had a birthday.  They're all big meat eaters and loved their steaks. I don't eat meat and I'm usually fine with a starter and side.  But almost nothing here is meat free--the pasta starter had "veal jus", almost everything else (even the caviar) had some kind of meat broth, drippings, or garnishes, even the potatoes had meat drippings, and  THE BROWNIE AND ICE CREAM are made with Waygu fat.  No ceasar salad, no fries or meat free potatoes, no creamed spinach, etc.  However, if everyone in your party loves meat you're good.  And the service is excellent, and good drinks and Parker House rolls.  Avoid tables in which the waiters keep smacking the back of your chair, it's an unfortunate distraction in a nice restaurant like this.

Customer 262.Name: EddieP
Customer 262.Content:
This was the first time at Niku with my family of 4.  The appetizers ( crispy potatoes and oysters) were good and the mezcal drinks I ordered were also good.

Our steaks

Fillet mignon  rare
NY  med rare
Ribeye (x2) medium

My wife’s ribeye was undercooked
My sons fillet mignon was overcooked

The rest were cooked as requested

This was a $700 dinner and honestly it  wasn’t worth  it.

Customer 263.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 263.Content: Good ambience and very friendly staff. They take time to explain menu and recommendation when asked. I was hoping slightly more serving for the sides and appetizer

Customer 264.Name: KimberlyN
Customer 264.Content: I had a better experience last year. I felt like the staff could have spent a lot more time educating us on the meats and A5 that were ordered. Everything was a bit rushed.

Customer 265.Name: MichaelH
Customer 265.Content: The restaurant was amazing. From the greeter to the service. They where very welcoming and informative when it came to questions with the menu. I would defiantly recommend Niku to everyone looking for a great experience.

Customer 266.Name: carlob
Customer 266.Content: Amazing place. Premium meats, great atmosphere. 10/10

Customer 267.Name: HowardL
Customer 267.Content: The A5 tasting was exceptional, melts in your mouth.  However, the tomahawk rib eye was extremely stringy & chewy, that I had to throw out sections of the steak.  The steak also lacked a nice crust, and I asked the waiter to create a good charred crust.

Customer 268.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 268.Content: Excellent. Amazing service and extraordinary food.

Customer 269.Name: Justin
Customer 269.Content: Excellent bone marrow, wonderful salad and a perfectly cooked rib-eye.  Not been back for a few years and forgotten how good the food and service is.  Bot cheap though!

Customer 270.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 270.Content: My husband and I came here for our anniversary. The service was amazing and so was the food. Highly recommend.

Customer 271.Name: wingj
Customer 271.Content: A good first time experience to celebrate the holidays with family.

Customer 272.Name: LowieL
Customer 272.Content: The Miyazaki steak was amazing and the filet mignot was meaty and tender. The potatoes with the sour cream was delicious, my boyfriend usually hates sour cream but he loved this one. Also being able to watch the chefs prepare all the meat was amazing, all of them were very skilled cooks.

Customer 273.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 273.Content:
Excellent food, great service
Best steaks we’ve had
Would come again

Customer 274.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 274.Content: Niku is one of my favorite dinners I’ve had in 2023. Excellent food, immaculate vibes. We sat at the chefs counter and got to talk to the chef who was in charge of the pickling and it was super cool to learn about their process. The chefs counter was a great experience, better than a table. 10/10

Customer 275.Name: JoshuaA
Customer 275.Content: One of the best meals I’ve had in my life. Went for a date night and got upgraded seating. The experience was top tier.

Customer 276.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 276.Content: Food was average and very pricey. Scene was very nice and counter seating was really fun! But not worth it by any means

Customer 277.Name: MonaE
Customer 277.Content: This 1 Michelin star restaurant honestly feels like a 3 star place. Service was superb, attentive, and detail oriented. I once dropped my napkin and they picked it up and gave me a new napkin! The sommelier was very knowledgeable, friendly and warm. We had the pig ears and bone marrow, amazing! Then we tried the A5 wagyu tasting, which is the best meat ever! Our red wine paired well with all the foods, I’m in love with this restaurant!

Customer 278.Name: AmyC
Customer 278.Content: It was our first time at Niku and we had a great dining experience at the chef table.

Customer 279.Name: LouisB
Customer 279.Content: Food is outstanding, never had a better steak!  That said, all the dishes were amazing. The composition ranged from simply delicious to complex delicious.

Customer 280.Name: Katy
Customer 280.Content: So incredible! Amazing service, great food! Try A5, you won’t be disappointed!

Customer 281.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 281.Content: Had a great experience and would definitely come back. Staff was very nice and accommodating and the food was delicious!

Customer 282.Name: DoraC
Customer 282.Content: Excellent service, food outstanding , Birthday Celebration

Customer 283.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 283.Content:
Chris, Rebecca and Chef Celtin were gracious, hospitable and inviting. The service was warm, friendly and very comfortable. The food was absolutely delicious and was all we could ask for. Every item on the menu was spot on. The temperature on the steak, the warm plates, the squash and the porcini tortelli was lovely.

The other members of the FOH team were also very attentive on the wine levels, table maintenance and water.

Thank you for everything! Keep smiling, Chris!

Customer 284.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 284.Content: Thank you Chris and Niku team for a great night. Amazing service and food as always.

Customer 286.Name: Watchking
Customer 286.Content:
I found this place while we were going to another Sushi place down the street. I found out later that is had a Michelin star. I booked it for my wife's Birthday. It's the only steakhouse on the list in the world which says a lot.

We arrived and it is dark at the front. I almost missed it. I could finally see inside when I got to the front. No big signage. As you enter you see the hug wall of liquor and all high end. I loved it. Nice and long and lots of booze. Really classy.

We were greeted and I told them our name. We were seated right away. It was back away from the wood fire pit. This is where the magic happens. You could see the owner/chef working his magic.

We ordered the matsutake soup, brassica cappelletti and the bone marrow to start off. The soup had great flavor and the cappelletti was yummy. The bone marrow was so good and liked the bread with it.

Next was the 44 farms prime ribeye and a5 Miyazaki. both were cooked perfectly. The wagyu was just like in Japan. You never find the real deal in the states. We got the crispy potatoes and it was amazing and perfect to go with our steaks. I should of got some rice hahah.

It was neat that they bring over a tray of different knives from you to pick from to use on your steaks. They are mostly made from Italy and I picked the cleaver. It was really sharp.

We got the ginger lemon custard which was good but strong ginger taste. Then the olive oil cake which my wife really enjoyed.

The food was amazing and you could tell that they were deserving of the Michelin Star.

Customer 287.Name: LelandA
Customer 287.Content:
First timer here! Loved the experience.

Me and my partner sat at the chef’s counter for the full experience, and it did not disappoint.
I have to start off by saying that the music was impeccable - I’m a pretty big hip hop fan, and the songs I heard, I was NOT expecting on a steakhouse aux. Big ups to whoever was on aux - you just solidified us coming back.

From the bartender to the servers and chef, service was outstanding. Ian was patient, helpful, and communicable. The chef in particular gave us tips on how to dine in a Michelin-star restaurant, which is fantastic, as I was just under the impression that pre-bussing the table was ‘out of consideration.’ But as the chef has taught us, intention may be trumped by impact, and that was the lesson of the night. Great service, I couldn’t say it enough.

The wagyu tomahawk was huge and delicious. Good amount of fat, the crust was perfect, my partner said it was the most flavorful tomahawk we’ve had, and we’ve had quite a few around the bay, in hawaii, NY. Steak was cooked perfectly medium rare, and we enjoyed every bite at the chef counter, and later when we got home for a late night snack.

If you’re in your steak era, you have to come to Niku steakhouse, you just have to. Thank you, Niku! We’ll be back!

Customer 288.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 288.Content: The food was phenomenal and the service was excellent. I highly recommend it.

Customer 289.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 289.Content: Such a great experience. Felt well taken care of from start to finish!

Customer 290.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 290.Content: Amazing servers, outstanding services. Loved the steak and its side!

Customer 291.Name: InaS
Customer 291.Content: Niku Steakhouse has the best food and service in SF. It’s my favorite SF restaurant.

Customer 292.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 292.Content: For the high end restaurant it's meant to be the quality of the A5 tasting at $400 was subpar.

Customer 293.Name: BlissWonder
Customer 293.Content: Food was exceptional. The service started off really good and then massively dropped off and was a real disappointment.

Customer 294.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 294.Content: The Niku staff went out of their way to help us make my parent’s 40th anniversary one to remember! I’m so grateful we got to spend such a special night having unique food and drinks!

Customer 295.Name: AmeliaR
Customer 295.Content: We had an excellent experience, the food is amazing. The staff are attentive, highly recommend.!

Customer 296.Name: jameswalt
Customer 296.Content: The food was delicious, but we were seated 30 minutes late and while we were trying to order drinks at the bar, the hostess came to us and told us to leave the bar area. It was really offputting and unexpected for a restaurant of this caliber. The dinner service was fantastic, but the restaurant failed to offer anything for making us wait so long for our table. We had at least 5 different people apologize for the wait and thank us for our patience, but I think offering a drink or two or a dessert on the house would have gone a long way to show this isn't typical business. Overall I enjoyed the experience but it is not worth $550 for 2 people.

Customer 297.Name: ZhanL
Customer 297.Content: Wonderful food, wonderful service, and amazing environment. Will definitely go back again, great place to go if you taking your love one or future love one on a date night and anniversary.

Customer 298.Name: JustinO
Customer 298.Content: The best steak i've ever had.  Hands down.

Customer 299.Name: RossellaD
Customer 299.Content: The very beautiful experience. Wangyu was wonderful, unforgettable. Thanks!!

Customer 300.Name: JRoykirk
Customer 300.Content: An exceptional restaurant top to bottom.  The staff and service are impeccable and the food is outstanding.  The pig ears are so good you can’t stop eating them, the ginger scallion rice is delicious and the steak is perfectly cooked.  A genuinely great meal and I highly recommend it to one and all.

Customer 301.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 301.Content: Simply stellar. Food was fantastic and perfectly cooked. Service was impeccable. Highly recommend.

Customer 302.Name: x5115
Customer 302.Content: Awesome food and experience! 100% recommend. You will enjoy it.

Customer 303.Name: AlexA
Customer 303.Content:
Absolutely incredible! We were greeted by the Sommelier Nick who brought us to our table and explained the menu.  There were 4 of us and based on his recommendations for food and wine we scored and really appreciated all his help!

For dinner we shared and started with the Bone Marrow, Steak Tartare, Oysters and Parker House Rolls.  As the main course we shared the special "Drunken Wagyu" and Rib Eye.  Each was cooked to perfection and we had leftovers for the next day.   We chose Crispy Potatoes & Maitake Mushrooms.  The Miso Creme fraiche that came with the Potatoes was divine.

Dessert we shared an Olive Oil Cake that had 3 different preparations of Pineapple. It was the perfect ending to the meal.

Thank you for having such a great Sommelier who made this evening extremely special!

Alex

Customer 304.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 304.Content: Food is excellent just such a boring place unfortunately

Customer 305.Name: Foodie
Customer 305.Content: For the expectation this restaurant wants to set it does not deliver a 5-star experience.

Customer 306.Name: Patric
Customer 306.Content: Wonderful dining experience start to finish. It was a crowded Friday night, but the front desk kept their cool and patience and made everyone feel welcomed and taken care of. Once seated, Preston was an incredible guide for the evening! He helped us navigate the menu, offered suggestions and made sure our dietary restrictions were communicated to the kitchen. Course after course was just lovely! The best fish starter I’ve ever had, best potatoes and rice I’ve ever had and a 1st rate steak. We requested a window seat and the noise level was perfect, just lovely enough for a small Dining room. The staff was attentive, but they didn’t hover or rush us. It was a relaxed, entertaining, delicious and elegant evening in the City. Well done Niku!

Customer 307.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 307.Content: First off, the service was impeccable. The staff were amazing and made sure our experience was memorable (and tasty). I can’t recommend the place enough based on the service alone. The food was also great and we ordered multiple items to share, which was easy to do and made the experience feel “fuller” because we got to try lots of different things. Highlights include the pig ears, the eggplant, the wagyu, and the mousse dessert. And the potatoes were excellent, as well.

Customer 308.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 308.Content: Great experience, great service! chef counter seating highly recommended!

Customer 309.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 309.Content: Great experience and excellent food. Only point i didnt fully appreciated are their choice of wineglasses. They will serve you bold wines in universal glasses while bigger glasses would be more appropriate to air and easy of drinking.

Customer 310.Name: AnnaK
Customer 310.Content:
Tonight, we indulged in a culinary experience at Niku Steakhouse in San Francisco that was nothing short of exquisite. From the very first bite, it was clear: the food transcends ordinary delight, charting its own territory in extraordinary flavor. Among the steaks I've savored over the years, the one at Niku easily contends for the top spot.

Our meal commenced with two distinct appetizers: a creatively crafted eggplant dish and a fresh, vibrant salad. Both set high expectations for what was to follow. The main event, a 6oz. A5 steak, was exceptional, its rich flavors and melt-in-your-mouth texture affirming its premium quality. Accompanying sides of perfectly roasted potatoes and crisp shishito peppers complemented the steak beautifully.

However, our experience was blemished by an unusually long wait for our main course. Despite the restaurant's evident bustle, a two-hour wait in a fine dining setting felt disproportionate, even misplaced. Patience was tested, though the staff's politeness was constant.

Redemption came in the form of dessert--a brownie so divine, it bordered on celestial. It dissolved any lingering frustration, leaving behind a sweet aftertaste and fond memories.

Would I return? For the food, a resounding yes.

Yet, a note on expectations: when an evening's fare ventures into the realm of $600 plus tip, one anticipates service that mirrors the excellence of the cuisine. While the culinary journey at Niku was largely unparalleled, there remains room for improvement in harmonizing the service with the establishment's high calibre. The symphony of a perfect dining experience requires both elements in concert.

Customer 311.Name: MicK
Customer 311.Content: Everything we order was delicious ! Great service but unfortunately they ran out of a dessert cocktail for the birthday boy and looking at pictures of previous black sesame ice cream that was order I was a bit disappointed they charge $7 for a plain small scoop of ice-cream😝 Overall gorgeous restaurant with amazing staff and on the point food !

Customer 312.Name: HDOV
Customer 312.Content: fantastic experience , this is a must do if you in San Francisco

Customer 313.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 313.Content: The food was amazing and portion is great. Service was top notch. Birthday boy approved it is a 10/10.

Customer 314.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 314.Content: Spectacular experience for our one year anniversary. Service was above and beyond. Every bite of what we ordered was out of this world. Highly recommend sitting at the chefs counter— fun to watch the action.

Customer 315.Name: MichaelF
Customer 315.Content: Dustin & team are hands down, the best at their craft. If you get a chance to snag a seat at the Chef’s Counter, I highly recommend the experience.

Customer 316.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 316.Content: It was fantastic - the food was exceptional. Service was on point.

Customer 317.Name: Mando
Customer 317.Content: Service is wonderful. They are very attentive and go above and beyond if you have any allergies. Food was unforgettable. Highly recommend for special occasions. If you go on your actual birthday, they give you a complimentary treat.

Customer 318.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 318.Content: Absolutely amazing experience. The Sommeliers, the delicious food, and the extremely accommodating service are always a highlight. The beef is perfection, the side are spectacular, and the wine, divine. Thoroughly recommend, you’ll never regret having coming.

Customer 319.Name: jenle4
Customer 319.Content:
I love the service provided by the staff. They were super attentive to our needs and went a great deal to make sure that our table is taken care of. The wine that the staff recommended went well with the steaks that we ordered. 

We ordered Prime Ribeye, New York steak, and Filet Mignon, all cooked medium rare. For starters, we got the beef tartare, halibut, and the bone marrow. The bone marrow and beef tartare were AMAZING! 

We will definitely be coming back to Niku Steakhouse!

Customer 320.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 320.Content: The food at Niku was incredible! However, the service was a little slow and there was not much cohesion among the staff members.

Customer 321.Name: LoriB
Customer 321.Content: Always a good choice. Very expensive but amazing food and great for special occasions.

Customer 322.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 322.Content: Wow out of all our times here this was the worst experience and possible one of the worst dinners. From the first course coming 40 mins after we placed the order to the insanely chewy antelope or the lack of service.  Too many to list but if there is a person in management who cares enough please reach out.

Customer 323.Name: JohnW
Customer 323.Content:
Niku offered very good cuisine, and we enjoyed the dining experience. However, the service fell short of expectations, with delays in food,
Drink refills, and other oversights. Ultimately, a satisfactory but not exceptional evening. Especially for a Michelin rated establishment

Customer 324.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 324.Content: The food is the most flavorless beef and wagu I ever tasted. Ingredients were good and texture of the meat was done right but the execution of flavor was horrible. Staff was attentive but the way they ran around like headless chickens made me feel like their system was a bit disorganized. @$400 bucks for a tomahawk (non-A5) and 3 oz A5 Hiroshima Wagu, I expect a bit more flavor and seamless experience.

Customer 325.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 325.Content: I cannot express how happy and satisfied my family was coming here. The moment we walked into the door, we were greeted and treated with hospitality. From the front of the house, to the food service and waiters, and to the back of the house; the customer service was impeccable, organic and down to earth. It  made the experience of enjoying our meal all that easier and better! The food is so delicious and the drinks were legit- spot on! Order anything on the menu and I promise you will not be disappointed. We will be definitely coming back here.

Customer 326.Name: notoriousirg
Customer 326.Content: One of the best meals I’ve ever had. The corn pasta was to die for. The steak was perfect. Will definitely be back!

Customer 327.Name: Hero
Customer 327.Content:
PROS:

Very delicious and curated selection of food. 

Nothing too pretentious or unapproachable. 

Most diners were dressed between casual, semi-formal, cocktail, to business so you kind of make it what you want.

Servers are very attentive, and knowledgeable with their recommendations (Chris gave us the most attention/help).

Some free extras like a one bite taster, and some bubbly and a fancy cupcake for our anniversary.

The food is very staggered and it almost comes out as a three course meal (starters, steak and sides, dessert). They clean your table between each portion and give you new plates.

Devil in the details: The host came back to our table with a tableside purse hanger as they noticed the lady brought her purse and hung it on the chair. They pour all the drinks for you tableside. Smaller things like I hadn't put the cloth over my legs yet and they carefully draped it over for me; they even folded the cloth over while my parter went to the restroom ad they noticed it was crumpled to the side. You definitely feel pampered/monitored in a good way.

Patient. We closed out the restaurant clocked in a 3 hour dinner. Even then, they made sure we could still enjoy our dessert and wrap up our conversation without any real looks of rush.

CONS:

The steaks came out a bit cold. We didn't realize why it wasn't as soft as it should be until after thinking about why it wasn't (mostly speaking of the Tomahawk). For what you pay for and it being a steakhouse, the internal temperature is obviously important but the serving temperature is just as crucial...not sure if the steak sat there a bit before it came to our table but we were expecting soft warm  bites.

Price can be steep for what you get and especially may feel even steeper when things feel off with your food but fortunately our experience with the steak wasn't too off. I think you have to come with the mindset of not only food but ambience and service included in the pricing.

Customer 328.Name: Peggie
Customer 328.Content: Portions are large on the mains.  Be prepared for a lot of meat 🥩.  It’s prepared well to taste.

Customer 329.Name: StaceyU
Customer 329.Content: The service was outstanding. The Staff was attentive and friendly. We received the starters on time; however, it took them over an hour to serve the main dishes. No one explained to us why there was such a long delay. Otherwise, we had a positive experience.

Customer 330.Name: TeresaM
Customer 330.Content: I had such high hopes for this place but almost everything that could have gone wrong did. There was nobody to greet us at arrival. Our server, I have to say, was extremely nice and did his best. The sommelier did not open the bottle in front of us, served the wine once, then spent the rest of the night drinking at the bar. The food was great, except the tomahawk which was average at best, but a bit overpriced - especially considering the overall service. Overall, it’s just really badly managed and a waste of a great kitchen. I would’ve been happy spending maybe $300 for this experience but the $950 total (for 2) was a waste of money and an absolute robbery…

Customer 331.Name: Nick
Customer 331.Content: The food and service were great. The restaurant is on the expensive side, but well worth it for a special occasion or to try some great cuts of meat.

Customer 332.Name: EugeniaB
Customer 332.Content: From start to finish the experience was great. The bar is small but cozy with a great selection of every liquor you can think of. We were sitting at the chef’s counter( an experience of its own to be able to interracial with the chefs). We ordered the oysters, the bone marrow, and the tomahawk steak. The portions were quite generous. The tomahawk steak was huge! We barely finished it, mainly because we couldn’t stop savoring every piece of the perfectly cooked meat. The bone marrow was delicious! The oysters were very well seasoned and were a nice prep dish for all of the meat to come. We’ll be back!!!!

Customer 333.Name: LylaA
Customer 333.Content:
If there were 6 [or more] stars OpenTable gave me to rank, I'd gladly give them to Niku! Dined there last night for a 3rd date, & the service overall by everyone in-house was STELLAR.

Every single menu item we had was exquisite & thoughtfully crafted; I truly don't think you can go wrong by ordering *anything* here!

Thank you to Ivana for exceptional attention to detail & fantastic service. The bar team & Matt knocked it out of the park on the libations as well: the Country Pie was, without a shadow of a doubt, my favorite cocktail of 2023, by far - oh my goodness.

Go to Niku, you won't regret it!

Customer 334.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 334.Content: Excellent experience! My husband and I made a reservation. We originally reserved for chef’s counter but decided on the table when we got there. The hostess was very accommodating and got us a table with little wait time. The staff were knowledgeable and friendly!

Customer 335.Name: Steve
Customer 335.Content: Niku is a memorable experience we will never forget! Everything about our visit was top notch. From the moment you enter and are greeted by the friendly staff to the view of the open grilling area (especially if you sit at the counter surrounding the grill) to finally tasting the decadence and love put into every last bite. Take your time and take in the whole of the experience.

Customer 336.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 336.Content: Terrible wait service and got served a super rare steak that I had to send back

Customer 337.Name: Shark
Customer 337.Content:
We made reservations here two months before our trip, for my husbands 60th birthday celebration.  We sat at the ‘chefs table’, right up front overlooking the kitchen.  We spoke to the chef and his chef de partie, during our dinner.  It was amazing!  An experience we will never forget.  We ordered the tomahawk steak.  It was very good, but we thought a little chewy.  The bone marrow appetizer was outstanding!  Service was excellent.

Overall, an amazing experience and we highly recommend this restaurant and would go back again.

Customer 338.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 338.Content: Great food and cocktails but expensive!   Service was top notch.

Customer 339.Name: DRock
Customer 339.Content: It was a fantastic experience, highly recommend the chefs counter experience. The chefs are friendly and experts at what they do. The wagyu steaks are excellent, but the Flat Iron is one of the best steaks I've ever had.  Cooked to perfection, and you get to watch the whole thing right in front of you.

Customer 340.Name: Shawn
Customer 340.Content: Did not care for this place. The Wagyu tasting was not good. Went with two others, none of us thought it was very good.

Customer 341.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 341.Content: Great food, perfect service! Niku Steakhouse, keep moving forward, achieve more!

Customer 342.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 342.Content: Great food and excellent service. Just expect to take your time. We were seated at 7 and had our steak come around 8. It was worth it but come expecting that

Customer 343.Name: Viktoria
Customer 343.Content: Fantastic! Every time we are in San Francisco we come here. Phenomenal food! We always book seats at the chef’s counter, so it makes dinner extra special. Chefs at Niku Steakhouse are great! It’s fun to watch them and sometimes to have a small talk. Quality of food is great!

Customer 344.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 344.Content: Appetizers were good, a bit salty for my liking. The ribeye that I got was decent, I think I only ate like 25% of the steak, the grilled mushroom was very dry. It's not a good side dish. The cocktail that was recommended by our lovely server was very good, I ordered it twice. Service was great, but whoever took the rest of my steak to pack it up for me probably forgot about it (or was taking too long) so we just paid and left. Total for two is about $400+.

Customer 345.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 345.Content: Rebecca was amazing!  Food and experience were 2nd to none!  Can't wait to comeback!

Customer 346.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 346.Content: Food was creative overall but steak was a bit disappointing considering the value. Ordered the bone marrow, ambrosia melon and the pig ears: the bone marrow was our favorite. As for the steaks, we got the prime rib and the New York steak: NY steak was flavorful but prime rib was tough and did not have as much flavor as anticipated. Will probably come back for dinner but will try other dishes.

Customer 347.Name: AlexC
Customer 347.Content: Outstanding food....service well below par for high end steakhouse

Customer 348.Name: Yvonne
Customer 348.Content:
Nikki Steakhouse is great!
Great food, great drinks, and the stuff is especially great.  ￼ Ellis did a great job and unfortunately I didn’t get the name of our server, but he was also great. We went for my husband‘s birthday they did a fantastic job to make us feel special. I will definitely be going back again. ￼

Customer 349.Name: RobinR
Customer 349.Content: Franco is the best! The food and service is just fantastic

Customer 350.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 350.Content: Fantastic food and overall great service. I’m not a big red meat eater but when it’s prepared like they

Customer 351.Name: MindB
Customer 351.Content: This made a special occasion all the more special, was incredibly happy with the service, food, and atmosphere. Arrived with a birthday card for my wife and a special dessert with a candle at the end of our meal. The A5 tasting was out of this world and our server had exceptional recommendations across the menu. Can't wait to go back!

Customer 352.Name: LorelleG
Customer 352.Content: Phenomenal. A definite once in your lifetime visit.

Customer 353.Name: SadaqatO
Customer 353.Content: Great steak, even better appetisers and desserts. Highly recommend.

Customer 354.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 354.Content: The decorations, services, attention to detail are very good. But, the star of the restaurant is suppose to be to meat and I was disappointed especially given that it has 1 Michelin star. The steaks has a strong charcoal grill flavor which is interesting , but they tasted blend, lacking in flavor and seasoning. I was expecting it to be very juicy and have a strong kick in the taste bud but nothing. I am not saying it is bad but if you are good, you can use cheaper ingredients and create equally if not more enjoyable meal.

Customer 355.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 355.Content:
Great all around…. We brought a really nice bottle of wine to celebrate…. But then we couldn’t drink it because they had it in there cellar. It makes no sense to me personally, we are right by Napa of course they have every bottle of fine Napa wines. I’ve been to some nicer restaurants with a cork fee but I have never seen this happen before. Big turn off. Steak was perfect sides and apps were flawless but when your spending around 1500 for a dinner I would figure they would let us open our own bottle of wine. Or please make this very obvious when booking a reservation.

But again. Best steak I have ever had. This was the one “lowlight”

Customer 356.Name: VictoriaR
Customer 356.Content: The steak here is absolutely exceptional. We had the dry aged New York strip and the Takamori drunken wagyu—which was to die for. The maitake mushroom side was also an unforgettable experience.  We ordered the pickles too, and they served as a pleasant palate cleanser.  The pickled cucumber skin was a standout, however.  We had lots of starters, including the little gems salad, the steak tartare, the bone marrow, and the corn tortelloni.  All were delicious, but the steak mains were the undisputed stars. The only complaint about the tartare is it was very garlicky and blew out our palates for the next course—the tortellini—a bit. Morsels of beef in the bone marrow overwhelmed the delicate marrow flavor a bit.  All of the cocktails were very well done.  For dessert, we had the sweet pea mousse and the “meadow” herbal tea infusion.  The strawberry sorbet on the side of the mousse was packed with fresh strawberry flavor.  My only wish is that the chlorophyll freshness of sweet pea were stronger in the mousse. White chocolate overwhelmed the pea taste a bit.  The infusion was a beautiful and calming finish to the meal.  Overall, this was a fantastic experience. The staff was attentive and friendly.  I would gladly come here again.

Customer 357.Name: Elsie
Customer 357.Content:
This dinner started badly, with the receptionist saying they were moving us to a table in the dining room, great, so we agreed to have a drink at the bar; as soon as we ordered she asked us to move to our table, great, so we stood up, then she said she was taking another couple in so we stood there oddly, then another employee tried to take us to a different table in the bar, and then was stopped....aaaaaa....
but once the food started to come this was largely forgotten.  Great salad, my husband said best he's ever had; son loved the bone marrow and his steak; don't miss the potatoes.  And having them offer you a choice of knives is fun.  One more issue--the many waiters that bumped me in the back as I was eating. I'll go back, but will ask not to sit with my back to the inside bar where the cooking happens.

Customer 358.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 358.Content: Awesome experience 10/10 would recommend. Our server Matthew was very knowledgeable and attentive.

Customer 359.Name: KaylaV
Customer 359.Content: We had a remarkable dinner celebrating my husband's birthday. Our server Eric was top notch and full of knowledge to guide us through our culinary journey. Details are key and enhance each experience to make each individual feel special in that moment. Eric taking away that I personally work in hospitality and noting that in a conversation was small detail that I personally didn't share with him, but briefly mentioned to the bartender. The communication between the server & bartender is key to make each experience unique even if it is a small detail creates special moments. Well done Niku your team is truly dynamic!

Customer 360.Name: MaxenceJ
Customer 360.Content:
It was an amazing experience for our engagement dinner. Ian was stunning and the rest of the team also. A5 was excellent. The waiters known their subject and gave us precious advices.

Thanks again to Ian for the little suprise at the end of the dinner

Definitly a must do

Customer 361.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 361.Content: All of the foods are fantastic, the bone marrow was valuable to eat especally. I'll haver a dinner when I visit SF again.

Customer 362.Name: omnomnom
Customer 362.Content: Great night, fantastic meal, excellent service + ambience!  a5 wagyu for the win!

Customer 363.Name: JOEW
Customer 363.Content: Best steakhouse I’ve ever been too. Don’t expect a cheap meal but service meets the price. 12/10

Customer 364.Name: RobinR
Customer 364.Content: The meat is varied and fantastic! Franco, the beverage manager, is a genius. What he does when you describe your flavor profile and what he creates is an art.

Customer 365.Name: DarlingK
Customer 365.Content: Fantastic, elegant, and delicious! Went for an anniversary celebratory date and really enjoyed our experience. Eric was a top-notch, thoughtful, and attentive guide throughout our meal.

Customer 366.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 366.Content: Had a reservation for two for a date night and it was a lovely experience dining at Niku, highly recommend for any steak enthusiasts. We were greeted by friendly and helpful staff and they were very thoughtful and provided great service for us. Beautiful restaurant and bar area, and we loved the chef's counter seats and the wagyu fat brownie (a Niku must-have). We also ordered the oysters and we finished them within 5 minutes because they were so flavorful and delicious!

Customer 367.Name: SeanD
Customer 367.Content: What a spectacular meal and experience. Niku knows how to do it right.  The service was fantastic and the ambience great.  A definite stop for steak lovers looking for a superb dining memory!

Customer 369.Name: RicardoA
Customer 369.Content: One of the best steakhouses I've been. Food is extraordinary, great service, an absolutely most for San Francisco

Customer 370.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 370.Content: Great venue and service was amazing. The wonderful surprises were the oysters, pig ears and potatoes. The steaks were as expected but we expected a lot coming in.

Customer 371.Name: FerHill
Customer 371.Content:
Corn tortellini...extraordinary. But meat, a little bit to dry for me. 
I think a little bit too expensive, too.

Customer 372.Name: Elle
Customer 372.Content: Amazing service, modern ambiance, very stylish space. We enjoyed most dishes especially the wagyu and the corn tortellini but found that the NY strip was a tad overcooked.

Customer 373.Name: VincentL
Customer 373.Content: Fantastic experience eating here this week.  Steaks (ate a5 sampler and filet) were well cooked.  Salad was great and pig's ears were unique and worth getting and trying (i'd recommend adding pepper to the pig's ears).  Wagyu potatoes were great

Customer 374.Name: NathanielD
Customer 374.Content: An excellent option for beef lovers and part-time meat eaters with quite a few vegetarian starter and side options that will fill up an herbivore. Good wine list, cool sake selections and very friendly staff.

Customer 375.Name: MasonK
Customer 375.Content: Amazing food, great atmosphere. Most impressive steakhouse in SF.

Customer 376.Name: Chris
Customer 376.Content: We enjoyed Niku Steakhouse and highly recommend it. Perfect dinner to celebrate my wife’s birthday.

Customer 377.Name: JohannA
Customer 377.Content: Staff was very hospitable and accommodating to our requests!

Customer 378.Name: AlexN
Customer 378.Content: Steak quality was top notch though could’ve been seasoned a touch more, corn tortelloni was definitely the highlight, yuzu custard for dessert was fantastic. Would definitely recommend to a friend, but not a place I’d go back to a second time.

Customer 379.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 379.Content: Had a birthday dinner for two in front of the grill. Servers were attentive to us, ensured dietary restriction requirements were met and expedited our meal so we could catch our show. And brought out extra food and desserts to ensure we had a great birthday dinner!

Customer 380.Name: RobertL
Customer 380.Content: A+++++++ Wow what’s a spot! Happy faces and happy belly’s

Customer 381.Name: JoCo
Customer 381.Content: Excellent meal: short ribs, rib-eye, off menu wagyu. Don't miss the side order of potatoes. Save room for dessert - brownie, sweet pea mousse. Delicious dinner with great service.

Customer 382.Name: JasonF
Customer 382.Content: Fantastic meal and great vibe. Meat was delicious and the drinks were killer. They treated my daughter like royalty for her very first fancy restaurant and birthday. Thank you.

Customer 383.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 383.Content: Attentive service and food overall is good. Only disappointing part is that they overcooked our steak especially given its a high priced steakhouse.

Customer 384.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 384.Content: Service was amazing as always! Thanks for a great time.

Customer 385.Name: CyrilZ
Customer 385.Content: Very good menu, the meat (and the rest too) was excellent.

Customer 386.Name: LuckyDuck
Customer 386.Content: A fun place to go for that special celebration. Sit at the kitchen if you like to watch the action as your cut is being prepared!

Customer 387.Name: Kaycee
Customer 387.Content: Food was excellent, service was attentive but not pushy, was pretty noisy and tables were very close together but neither of those would keep me from coming back. High prices but it was worth it!

Customer 388.Name: zeepro
Customer 388.Content: Sat at the Chef's table so we could watch the talent in action.  Real artists with the preparation.

Customer 389.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 389.Content:
As a guy that eats steak on a weekly basis and tries to
Master the fire this place blew my expectations out of the water. To sit in front of the chefs and watch them at their craft is by far as enjoyable as the steak. The cuts of steak were amazingly marbled and truly melted in your mouth. Cooked perfectly, asked for a medium and the chef re assured me of the quality and that medium rare is the true choice… he wasn’t wrong. The service although classy, still down to earth to make me feel comfortable. As I watched the chef prepare an order of the beef rib I was surprised to see that they made it in a similar way to mine. I saw him throwing away the thin pieces of fat, I quickly haunted him and said “if you’re just going to throw it away… is it possible
I could try it?” He cut me up a slice of the fat from the beef rib … now I have to come back for this specific cut!!!!!!

Favorite steak house don’t hesitate to go!!!

Customer 390.Name: allan
Customer 390.Content: Tremendous meat selection and great wines. Service was impeccable

Customer 391.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 391.Content: Great food, service was different. Not the most amazing experience especially on a bday

Customer 392.Name: Roberto
Customer 392.Content: We had a great time. The chefs are very engaging and all the servers are great!

Customer 393.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 393.Content: Trovo i prezzi troppo alti rispetto a ciò che siamo abituati in Europa. Comunque carne di qualità e ben cotta (medium-rare).

Customer 394.Name: BJWS
Customer 394.Content: We had a wonderful meal and experience at Niku Steakhouse.

Customer 395.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 395.Content: Excellent food and atmosphere, very delicious meats

Customer 396.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 396.Content: Amazing experience excellent customer service Food spectacular all meats melted in your mouth, always fresh i cant compare it in any steak house that we went through, their service was excellent place so beautiful and clean classy ambiance i highly recommended this place,  for sure we will be back often thank you for wonderful hospitality we are so grateful to Celebrate my Daughters Birthday in Niku Steakhouse 🥰🥰🥰🙏

Customer 397.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 397.Content: Amazing experience! Food was amazing and the whole atmosphere was just astounding. Highly recommend for a romantic dinner

Customer 398.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 398.Content: The service was top notch, they had a happy anniversary note ready for us when we sat down. Truly outstanding.

Customer 399.Name: JBake
Customer 399.Content: Unbelievably good wagyu. The wine, sides and appetizers were also excellent.

Customer 400.Name: ErnestC
Customer 400.Content: Food is very good and carefully thought out and prepared.  Far overpriced though

Customer 401.Name: Kris47
Customer 401.Content: The Wagyu tasting was great! But I super disappointed with the bone marrow it looked beautiful but all the marrow melted off and all we were left with was an oily mess at the bottom.  The sauce on the pig ears was too sweet. The pasta was good a bit on the heavy side. Salad was fine. The Bordeaux that was suggested needed more time in the bottle but definitely had potential.  Over all skip the apps and go straight to the steaks.

Customer 402.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 402.Content: It was amazing! And the bone marrow die for. I highly recommend.

Customer 403.Name: AroundTown
Customer 403.Content:
Excellent meal, except asparagus and artichokes sides were too cooked and creamy for my taste - needed more al dente freshness. Steaks (filet mignon) were fantastic. 

Without telling you in advance, the restaurant tacks on a nuisance fee to the bill (something about staff expenses). Our total, including tip and nuisance fees, was ~$500 for 2 of us (one cocktail and one glass of wine each).

Customer 404.Name: SuperMan
Customer 404.Content: Good for handout with friends, specially sitting along the Kitchen hight top table

Customer 405.Name: Tommy
Customer 405.Content:
Had a great time. 
Great friendly attentive staff!

Customer 406.Name: LLLL
Customer 406.Content: Definitely expecting more with the prices. We were specific with how we wanted our steak and ours came out completely rare and needed to be sent back. The food was ok. Service was ok. Overall it was just ok.

Customer 407.Name: ErrinL
Customer 407.Content: Everything from the service, to the ambiance, and food was top tier. The entire dinner was truly an experience. I recommend everyone to try this spot at least once in their lives!

Customer 408.Name: Deez
Customer 408.Content: Niku was amazing as always. The menu selection hasn't changed much since I last visited, but some of the A5 meats that were offered were different. Service is always top-notch, with a significant amount of care given to ensure a pleasant dining experience, but not so over-bearing that you feel bothered. Unless things change, I'll continue to be a patron whenever I'm in the mood for exceptional wagyu beef.

Customer 409.Name: Jonathanh
Customer 409.Content: My first time and definitely not the last delicious menu from start to finish, love the attention to detail

Customer 410.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 410.Content: Food was great.  Unfortunately service terrible. Took 35+ minutes to get first drink and downhill from there

Customer 411.Name: AshleyM
Customer 411.Content: From the time we entered to when we left, the service was phenomenal. The drinks were good and the food was even better. Chris our server did a wonderful job explaining the menu and answering any questions we had. Would definitely go again once back in San Francisco.

Customer 412.Name: IanH
Customer 412.Content: outstanding food, drinks and service! Totally worth the price.

Customer 413.Name: RianeC
Customer 413.Content: Will definitely come back again. All worth it for dinner date

Customer 414.Name: DesiA
Customer 414.Content:
Aside from the delicious food, You have one amazing asset - your staff. From hosts, to servers, to chefs, the people working at Niku and taking care of the customers are incredibly talented professionals. It’s such a pleasant dining experience when you’re cared for so well. We are heavily impressed with everyone with whom we had the pleasure to interact yesterday.
Thank you so much! You made my Mother’s Day very memorable and nice. We will
be back very soon! Keep up the great work.

Customer 415.Name: YummyChaser
Customer 415.Content: Amazing! Food and service was impeccable. Highly recommend!

Customer 416.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 416.Content: Tasty food with nice decoration, modern place for handout and excellent service

Customer 417.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 417.Content: We had the most wonderful time at Niku! I highly recommend it. We came for a special occasion and I am so grateful that we did. The food was phenomenal and we had lovely service.

Customer 418.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 418.Content: This was our 4th time here and it’s always been a great experience at niku. The filets were amazing and perfectly cooked. Service was good. The staff at niku are very nice and accommodating. It wasn’t too loud either which was perfect for our business meal. Will be back (:

Customer 419.Name: Jaythom
Customer 419.Content: This was an overpriced experience that lacked in attention to detail. Ended up having to remind them 3 times after initially putting it in the special details for the reservation. No compensation was given for this. Also, the food took an extraordinarily long time to be delivered and the steak could have been a lot more flavorful.

Customer 420.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 420.Content: Came here for my boyfriend’s birthday dinner and was absolutely impressed by the experience.  The customer service was impeccable and the food was PHENOMENAL! We highly suggest sitting at the Chef’s counter.

Customer 421.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 421.Content: The food is amazing as expected. It's the service though that will bring us back. Our server(s) were fantastic and took the experience you the next level

Customer 422.Name: SomanG
Customer 422.Content: We were on the high lounge seats, make sure you get the dining seats!

Customer 423.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 423.Content: I’ve been to hundreds of fine restaurants. The service was excellent, I feel the steaks were well cooked but not as a tasty as other steaks I’ve had. Overall I feel strongly when I say the steaks are wayyyyyyy overpriced. New York strip $125

Customer 424.Name: VitoM
Customer 424.Content:
I had been looking forward to coming to Niku for months, and when the day came, it did not disappoint. the restaurant was slightly smaller than anticipated, but by no means was it 'small' or 'cramped'. The ambiance was great, definitely felt high-end, but still had a casual air to the whole place. Our server, Eric, was absolutely amazing and extremely helpful when navigating the menu. Each and every dish was explained masterfully and led to a nice learning aspect to the whole dinner. When asking about the mains, not only did he explain the dishes, but proceeded to bring the raw cuts out to show us the difference in size and marbling. I cannot explain how happy we all were with the service and overall energy of the restaurant.

Starting dinner off, we ordered the crispy pig ears, bone marrow, and beef tartare as appetizers. All of them were phenomenal, but I personally have to give my favorite to the pig ears. Upon eating them, I was brought back to my childhood with the flavor profile. I was really looking forward to the bone marrow and tartare, but after tasting the pig ears, I was hooked (not to say I didn't indulge in the other dishes). When ordering the mains, I personally was able to try the tomahawk, filet, ribeye and NY strip. All were cooked great, but I would say the NY strip and filet really stood out. We ordered the rolls, asparagus, and mushroom as sides, and all three complemented the dinner perfectly. Each and every drink at dinner was great too, and I loved being able to try some rare whiskey as well. Each and everything at dinner added to this experience.

Lastly, I want to touch on why we all wanted to come to Niku in the first place: the Wagyu. We ordered the tasting platter and upgraded to the plate with the A5 Kobe. To keep it short, it did not disappoint. If you've never had wagyu, you got to give this a try! Everything was a great experience, and I can't wait to do it again.

Customer 425.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 425.Content: Too much security, however the ambience was amazing. Respect the staff…

Customer 426.Name: BerkeleyDad
Customer 426.Content:
We did have to wait 30 minutes from our reservation time, and were the next to last people in the restaurant. 
Hospitality was great, everyone was professional, and once seated, the experience was wonderful.
Very informative about the A5, and a singular experience.

Customer 427.Name: KrisB
Customer 427.Content: This was my first time at this restaurant to specifically try wagyu. I highly recommend the beef tartare and the filet mignon. The staff were helpful and knowledgeable about the menu/cocktails/wine selection. Will definitely be back!

Customer 428.Name: JayK
Customer 428.Content: Fantastic A5 Waygu tasting, every dish was amazing

Customer 429.Name: ChelseaW
Customer 429.Content: Food was exquisite and service was exceptional. The wine and steak pairing was so perfect as per the server’s recommendation. The chef’s table was such a great experience. Would love to come here again!

Customer 430.Name: AudreyBonneval
Customer 430.Content:
It was great ! We have tried the A5 tasting, the meat was delicious.
Nice ambiance et good service. Thank you

Customer 431.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 431.Content: This was to celebrate a birthday.  All the food came out nicely, but we were very disappointed with our tomahawk steak.  We asked for meds rare and it came out rare.  The knife cannot hardly cut it not the steak.  The me was like 80% rare and it was not really warm but more like room temperature meat.

Customer 432.Name: JakeA
Customer 432.Content: Always pretty fire. Good service. Good food. Nice atmosphere.

Customer 433.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 433.Content: Eric should give classes to front of the house folks.  What an amazing guide to a culinary journey.  Food was off the charts, including the often overlooked sides.  Nice music soundtrack and great vibe—everything you could want in a Michelin starred spot.

Customer 434.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 434.Content: We had a great time at Niku steakhouse. Had the A5 tasting menu with additional meat; wine / sake pairing was nice. Service was impeccable and it was a fun experience to sit at the chef's table.

Customer 435.Name: RusK
Customer 435.Content: Fantastic experience. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Food is amazing

Customer 436.Name: kyosky
Customer 436.Content: Great experience for special occasions! The service is outstanding. Every staff member was prompt and kind!

Customer 437.Name: JenniferC
Customer 437.Content:
Wow - an incredible dining experience!  Expensive  - but the dining experience is commensurate with the price tag.

The amuse bouche - a lovely starter.  We ordered the pig ears (OMG - so delicious) and the roasted bone marrow to start.  Both very decadent - if I only could pick one - it's the pig ears.  Braised - sweet and salty deliciousness.  Don't shy away from trying this dish - so good.  The roasted bone marrow is topped with mushrooms - very earthy, very hearty, delicious dish.

Our son ordered the wagyu tasty- pricey at $440 for 9oz of meat -but spring break and he has good grades!  He was in heaven - tender, and delicious.  He could tell the difference between the cuts - and really appreciated Japanese wagyu is nothing like American beef.  My husband and I shared the ribeye - more than enough for two.  We overindulged on sides - parker house rolls (for my husband- buckwheat never tasted so light and fluffy), the crispy potatoes (magical really),the pickled vegetables (necessary to cut through all the fat),and the roasted mushrooms (very earthy - probably could have done without).  We were stuffed but had to try the wagyu fat brownie - heavenly (again- don't shy away from trying this!).  Service was attentive and friendly, space was beautiful and comfortable.  View of the grill from the dining room was entertaining.  Highly recommend this as a special occasion experience - your wallet and waistline couldn't handle more than an occasional visit!

Customer 438.Name: jttmba
Customer 438.Content:
We are sitting at the counter right next to charcoal/wood-fired grill, where we were able to see chef Dustin Falcon and his team prepare steaks.

We started with Beef Tartare, which is delicious. We had A5 Wagyu tasting with their different types of Wagyu beefs which were perfectly cooked according to our order. Chef Dustin Falcon took time to explain and answer our questions. We had crispy potato (good!) and pickled vegetables (just ok!) for our sides.

The service was excellent! I impress Niku serves their wines with Zalto wine glasses.

Customer 439.Name: BryanA
Customer 439.Content:
Great spot. If you are a Japanese steak fan, you can't beat the selection here. Great sides, apps and drinks to pair. 

The menu can be pricey but Niku has the quality to match.

Customer 440.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 440.Content: Very elegant and high end. Good was good, great place to celebrate an occasion or a business engagement.

Customer 441.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 441.Content: One hour only got one appetizer on the table. 20mins without waiter refilling water. Napkins had extremely awful smell

Customer 442.Name: dyau
Customer 442.Content: Always good food and service. Our go to spot for special occasions.

Customer 443.Name: PierreG
Customer 443.Content: Room temperature was too low. Very noisy. Good food.

Customer 444.Name: Francis
Customer 444.Content: Went for birthday celebration and staff very attentive. Acknowledged birthday girl with nice note and birthday cupcake with candle. Sat at chef’s counter. Staff very knowledgeable about food preparation. The food was delicious especially the crispy potatoes and Yuzon custard dessert. Wonderful ambience with great/friendly staff

Customer 445.Name: StoreeC
Customer 445.Content: It was an absolutely delicious meal, accompanied by the most amazing waiter, Rube. He helped us pick meals perfectly tailored to our favorite tastes and paired it with the perfect champagnes.

Customer 446.Name: MrsGrigson
Customer 446.Content: First time visiting this restaurant. It was absolutely the best steak I've ever had. Service was perfectly attentive and charming but not intrusive.  Sitting in front of the chefs at the counter added to this unique dinner. Fantastic experience all around and bucket list for steak lovers everywhere.

Customer 447.Name: jgen
Customer 447.Content: Great service delicious flavors. Loved the non steak dishes!

Customer 448.Name: KristineS
Customer 448.Content: Had a great dinner at Niku Steakhouse. Amazing food, even better service!

Customer 449.Name: ElizabethN
Customer 449.Content: We had a really lovely dinner, and the joint stars of the show were our server Eric and the meat.  Eric knew so much about the food and the wine, and shared his experience with a really fun enthusiasm - not at all snobby/stuffy (even discussing wagyu and wine!). They also made things extra special for a birthday we were celebrating.  The food was all excellent.

Customer 450.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 450.Content: Came for my anniversary, staff was kind & very helpful! Food was perfect. Definitely returning in the future.

Customer 451.Name: EricT
Customer 451.Content: Niku was an amazing dinner. We were sat in front of the grill and were able to watch the chef and team put dishes together. It was a phenomenal meal and the food was cooked perfectly.

Customer 452.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 452.Content: Get the bone marrow & the brownie!! Absolutely incredible experience. Will be back soon.

Customer 453.Name: SixMichelinStarChef
Customer 453.Content: We had a very good experience with Niku: very good and attentive service, great food and nice wine recommendation. Thank you for a wonderful experience, and we will definitely come back again.

Customer 454.Name: DubsW
Customer 454.Content: Ivana was great.  Took awhile for food to come. Ordered a filet and came out cold, 75 minutes after order was placed. Wine menu was good, great variety.

Customer 455.Name: Hailey
Customer 455.Content: Overpriced and overrated. Come only if you are not paying

Customer 456.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 456.Content: Great food! Service was excellent. Definitely will be back!

Customer 457.Name: joseeight
Customer 457.Content: My review is harsh, but mostly because of the price and expectations. I did the A5 tasting, and I've done these in Japan, and can say that the meat wasn't grilled to perfection, which was a disappointment. The tartare was perfect, and so was the mushroom side, but the steaks were average in my opinion when it comes to preparation (uneven medium rare with some rare chunks that don't render the fat). I also wasn't a fan of the service, I was seated and waited nearly 20 minute before a waiter discussed the menu with me, and was sporadically attended throughout. The wagyu fat brownie dessert was fantastic. I'd say I would return but not for the steak.

Customer 458.Name: FoodCriticSF
Customer 458.Content:
Niku is once again a great place to dine and have some of the finest meats in the bay area.

During and just after the pandemic, although the food maintained its excellent standards the service was sub par. Niku ha remediated that with a top flight, attentive and knowledgeable staff. Highly recommended…once again.

Customer 459.Name: EthanT
Customer 459.Content: Everything went well with the service and food. However, the restaurant was too cold! We had to wear our coats for the whole dinner.

Customer 460.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 460.Content: I would like to thank Niku for being so accommodating when we initially thought we would have too many guests then we were one short and then another took a half an hour to arrive. The staff were very gracious throughout. The food was amazing. Decent playlist filling the air too!

Customer 461.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 461.Content: First time dinning at Niku and was blown away. Will definitely be back !

Customer 462.Name: GayathriS
Customer 462.Content: Now that’s a proper restaurant doing it the right way. I also think the wagyu (though it may seem expensive to a lot of people) is appropriately priced for being a high end restaurant. Loved every minute. Definitely coming back.

Customer 463.Name: Randall
Customer 463.Content: Sitting at the chef’s counter was awesome. We talked to the head chef all night and learned a lot about the different A5 steaks. His best suggestion was to order a regular steak and then to a sampler to compare the difference. We ordered the New York, Takamoti and Satsumi. NY was probably the best I’ve ever had, the Satsumi was so rich and melted in your mouth and the Takamori was on a whole mother level. The Takamori was rich and melt in your mouth just like the Satsumi, but with a ton of umami flavor. So amazing.

Customer 464.Name: OliviaK
Customer 464.Content: Excellent service right from the start. Great cuts of meat perfect prepared and delicious sides. The sommelier was not snooty and we enjoyed that.

Customer 465.Name: FerSuarez
Customer 465.Content:
Participated in the IWA pairing dinner. The experience with Richard G. and Chef Dustin was superb, splendid.  Definitely a unique Sake experience that will be hard to forget. 
Congratulations to everyone that put this experience together.

Customer 468.Name: ChrisD
Customer 468.Content: Top to bottom an amazing experience. It’s easy to see why they’ve kept their Michelin star - every detail is attended to, without anything seeming contrived or over-the-top. Food, service, ambience, and value (relatively) all hugely over-deliver. Get yourself a reservation!

Customer 469.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 469.Content: Amazing service. Top tier steak house.

Customer 470.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 470.Content: The staff were amazing. Our food was everything we wanted and more! We had a few things from the kitchen in between meals and they were tasty. The manager went above and beyond also to make our experience rememberable. We will definitely be back!

Customer 471.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 471.Content: Horrible not worth your time or money

Customer 472.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 472.Content: Great staff, great experience especially for a Saturday night when I’m sure they were swamped. Got to chat with the executive chef and his sous chef after watching them work their magic preparing steaks of all different cuts.

Customer 474.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 474.Content: The best steakhouse. We always come here and it’s never disappointed us. I can’t recommend it enough. The food is art and tastes like heaven, the steak is on a absolute other level. Can’t be beaten

Customer 476.Name: sprinkles5000
Customer 476.Content:
great food. annoying service. 

our main server had an incredible knack for interrupting our conversations over the course of 2 hours.

Customer 477.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 477.Content: The service was amazing the food was to good would go everyday if I could

Customer 478.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 478.Content: Was amazing, too quiet, the food delicious!

Customer 479.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 479.Content:
Locale curato , personale e servizio eccellenti , menù non entusiasmante , mi aspettavo di più per un ristorante stellato.
Esperienza generale molto piacevole , L attenzione del personale ti coccola e ti fa sentire importante .

Customer 480.Name: Claud
Customer 480.Content: Had an amazing dinner at Niku last night with friend and my boyfriend.  Although I was the sole pescatarian in the group, and at a steakhouse mind you - the staff and chef were very accommodating and everything I tried that was on the menu, including the Chicory Salad, Cod, bread, and Toffee Cake for dessert were amazing.  Very nice experience and ambiance overall. Will definitely be back for a date night :)

Customer 481.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 481.Content: Good food, just not the best place to have a business meeting.

Customer 482.Name: Faye
Customer 482.Content:
One of the best service I’ve ever experienced in SF.

The place where we seated was superb! Chef counter 12 o’clock! ❤️

It was my husband’s bday & our anniversary (21&22)Thank you Reuben. Wine pairings was excellent. Thank you also for the Rosè treat from provence. However my A5 wagyu steak was cold when served. I just dont wanna offend the chef and Reuben it’s an expensive steak to return. I don’t wanna ruin the night.

My husband’s medium rare was so rare but it was resolved so it’s ok. The food was soooooo LOOOOOONNNGGG to come out. Our dinner was 8:30pm we were seated after 8:45, the food was ordered past 9 and served 9:55 or close to 10pm.

I have a mixed feelings that’s why this review was late.

Honest feedback!

Pros: great experience due to hype & A5 Wagyu in the Bay.
Food taste: seasoned well.
Cons: Time to eat took so long.
Recommend to friends: YES
Repeat to dine:  NO

Thanks guys ❤️

Customer 483.Name: MarcussH
Customer 483.Content: Ambiance was amazing and service was even better! Food was to die for!

Customer 484.Name: Kristin
Customer 484.Content: The service was outstanding the moment we walked in. Instantly greeted accommodated while waiting for our table and even the other patrons were in a super good mood. Great energy. And food and was the best elevated experience. Great steak, beef tartar. Bone marrow, wine, desserts. Def would come back.

Customer 485.Name: Goldenstatekid
Customer 485.Content: Beautiful Seat at the bar. Left completely stuffed. Service was stellar. Meat lovers delight.

Customer 486.Name: LilyN
Customer 486.Content: Great ambiance, food and service! Would definitely come again!

Customer 487.Name: WilsonL
Customer 487.Content: The staff was extremely friendly and courteous. They were super knowledgable on all menu items and made our dining experience wonderful.

Customer 488.Name: MeganH
Customer 488.Content: Took my boyfriend for his birthday and we LOVED it! We sat at the chefs counter which was cool to see the food preparation, specifically the wood burning grill. We shared the salad and beef Tartar to start, then the filet and ribeye with potatoes. We usually prefer a ribeye but the filet was incredible! Ended the night the brownie.

Customer 489.Name: CelticTiger
Customer 489.Content: An excellent meal with very tasty mixed Wagu meatballs followed by a A5 Bushu-Gyu Wagu steak and excellent wage-fat fried crisp potatoes. A very enjoyable experience!

Customer 490.Name: Foodie
Customer 490.Content: This place used to be amazing and has become ungrateful for the business and the delivery was just average or below.   Very sad.

Customer 491.Name: JohnB
Customer 491.Content: We got the Wagyu A5 tasting which was extremely overpriced, we left the restaurant feeling hungry. If we're paying $500 for a meal that shouldn't happen.

Customer 492.Name: LeAnnL
Customer 492.Content: Great food! I will definitely be going back again.

Customer 493.Name: Lana
Customer 493.Content:
Wow wear do I start ... lets start with the food .. we ordered the beef tartare, and the bone marrow...some of the best beef tartare I have ever had in my life ! It was very smooth and rich! the meat was incredibly fresh ! The bone marrow was really good but there is not a lot in the bone, I still highly recommend it if you like bone marrow ! I even sucked on the bone ! For our main entree we got the tomahawk, potatoes and the rice. I am very proud of my partner and myself because we finished that whole steak and it is big! Definitely a good stake to share ! the potatoes were soo good and crispy but soft in the middle ! The rice was very rich and flavorful !  For dessert we did coffee and the toffee cake it was really good ! All the flavors just complimented each other in every dish...Also forgot to mention their drinks are soo amazing as well I recommend any of their cocktails. 

The ambiance at this restaurant is definitely  top tier. The staff makes sure the table is clean and clear at all times, they are all very nice and attentive to  the guests ! I would highly recommend this Niku to others for a date night or a celebration they are worth it !

Customer 494.Name: Sidario1
Customer 494.Content: Been to most high end steakhouses in the Bay Area and This is the worst steak house I’ve ever been . The steak is under seasoned and very tough to chew , when I say chewy ? It’s like rubber . The chef should try their steak first before serve . Safeway grocery have better meat quality than this steakhouse . Ate two small pieces with difficulty and I gave up  . had to take it home and cook it again , asked for medium rare and got a rare and it’s cold . Is definitely overpriced and overrated for the quality of the meat . I’m Not coming back here and not recommending this “steakhouse” to people I know . Im glad I only spend 600$ for part of 2 and not more . Went straight to InNout burger spend 15$ for 2 people and very satisfied

Customer 495.Name: Mmpc
Customer 495.Content: For this price point the quality of service was very poor. For this type of establishment you would expect superior service. The food was good but the service could have made the dining experience much much better. For a $650 meal for two it was not worth it at all.

Customer 496.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 496.Content:
I had VERY high expectations of Niku Steakhouse.

I’ve been purchasing meat next door at The Butcher by Niku Steakhouse for the past 3 years and know several of the butchers on staff. I am very familiar with the product offerings of Masami Cattle Ranch, Washugyu, Imperial, and El Rancho.

I was very excited to try the restaurant for the first time. We were seated at the counter, right in front of the action where the steaks were being grilled.

Both my guest and myself ordered the filet mignon and requested it rare, knowing that it is quite common for steaks to come out slightly more done than requested.

When we received the steaks, they were way overcooked for rare, were DRY, and mediocre at best. $105 each fillet and sadly no better than a $25 steak at a diner. Cold, Dry, and Sad cuts of meat.

Also the chefs who were working the grill conversed with groups to our left and to our right, but we did not receive any warm welcome from them. This experience made a bad steak worse.

The saving grace here was the tartare, bone marrow, crispy potatoes, and wagyu fat brownies.

But no one goes to a GREAT steakhouse merely for the appetizers and dessert.

I will give this place another chance for one of their ribeyes, but unlike baseball it will be 2 strikes for an out.

Customer 497.Name: CharlieC
Customer 497.Content: Bring your wallet, because it's worth the price :)

Customer 498.Name: ThomasT
Customer 498.Content: By yourself or with another person the grilling counter is a great place to watch meats being cooked and dishes be prepared.   Service was attentive and quick and knowledgeable.  Meats were rich and full and tasty.  Sides were just as well thought out the main courses.

Customer 499.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 499.Content: How to be disappointed in such a wonderful place?  Service is unbelievable, always around but not intrusive in the least (I used to be a waiter for 4 yrs).  If you can afford it, go there.

Customer 500.Name: AlexisK
Customer 500.Content: Such a great place for a splurge meal. Fun to sit at the counter and watch the cooking magic happen.

Customer 501.Name: Dante
Customer 501.Content: fantastic value as long as not getting that waygu.

Customer 502.Name: GoodGnoms
Customer 502.Content: This was a great date experience. I’m not sure it’s something I would crave to have again but it was fun. The drink (ring of fire) was great, the pig ears were disappointing. Pig ears are all about the cartilage but unfortunately, when you fry them, you lose that element. You could’ve replaced the pig ears with anything deep fried and it would’ve been the same. The steaks (tomahawk and ribeye) were fine. The potatoes are a must try. I can’t even imagine the amount of work that would take to make this. We were too full for desserts so no comment on that. Overall, interesting to try but not much of a push for a repeat.

Customer 503.Name: Graz
Customer 503.Content: Best steak we’ve had. Celebrated my boyfriends birthday and wish we could have been seated in the back to make it more intimate (we were by the bar/front door) but our server was incredible and still made it a special experience!!

Customer 504.Name: Grace
Customer 504.Content: The best service, dining, drinks, and ambiance! Sitting at the chef's counter was so great - got to watch them at work and ask questions about the steak!

Customer 505.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 505.Content: The food was amazing. The staff was extremely attentive and helpful. They gave excellent insight and recommendations. It was very expensive but was great for a special occasion and provided exceptional quality and service. Overall I would definitely come back to Niku for another special occasion.

Customer 506.Name: DeanL
Customer 506.Content: Absolutely phenomenal service from everyone. First time at Niku and they delivered every expectation. 10/10

Customer 507.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 507.Content: The food was phenomenal and the exquisite wine pairings enhance the experience that much more! The staff was very kind, friendly, and attentive. Excellent experience overall!

Customer 508.Name: DavidH
Customer 508.Content: Good ambience. Great food and service. Ordered a5 steak and prime rib along with 2 appetizers and 2 sides. Pricey but worth it

Customer 510.Name: LaurenB
Customer 510.Content:
The bone marrow and potatoes are the best!
I would return just for these two dishes. Service is spot on and fun

Customer 511.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 511.Content:
Ordered the Ribeye, and it was okay. No “wow” factor to it. Portion is best for two. I agree with some of the contrasting reviews that the service wasn’t that great, as I waited more than an hour for my food.
