Seemed like they were short-staffed, as I observed one waiter was covering half of the patrons. The prices didn’t seem worth it either. Only thing I found enjoyable was the pig ears.

Ambience was nice and lively with modern decor. A bit noisy, but still manageable to have conversations without speaking too loudly. Overall, it was a decent experience, but I’m hoping that the service and food turnaround time could improve.

Customer 512.Name: Joanne
Customer 512.Content: Food was amazing! Service was top notch, they came by to check on us and was very accommodating on our requests.

Customer 513.Name: Nico
Customer 513.Content: The service was amazing & the food was absolutely delicious.

Customer 514.Name: Eric
Customer 514.Content: An enjoyable sophisticated and rustic upmarket steakhouse!  The hostess immediately asked if there were any food allergies they needed to be aware of, and the manager and staff strove to do their best to accommodate.  Food expectations were beyond met, however the ribeye was slightly over seasoned with salt for my liking but doneness hit the mark.  The restaurant was well kept and facilities were immaculate.  The lighting was perfectly dimmed enough to allow for serene pleasure of food and company.  Overall, my experience at Niku was enough to revisit for another special occasion.

Customer 515.Name: TMurphyDines
Customer 515.Content: The service is top notch and the steak is all that it is hyped up to be. We had an amazing experience!

Customer 516.Name: KathyM
Customer 516.Content: That was one of the best meals I have ever had. Attentive service and gorgeous dining area. Will return.

Customer 517.Name: RavenA
Customer 517.Content: Was on time for reservation, booked table over a week in advance, and was given a table right by the front door. When asked if I could be moved to a different table the hostess was very helpful in trying to find a better seat as I was in a dress and did not want to keep a down coat on while eating dinner. For the amount of money I really wish the owner were more accommodating. He specifically said To not move me although there were multiple open tables in a dif seating area. It was disappointing and frankly rude, as I witnessed the conversation happening behind the bar between hostess and owner. It effected how much I wanted to even be there and how much I wanted to spend as I was ready and excited to go all in, but w the lack of accommodation it felt like I was just one more customer that did not mean much to them. It was delicious food and I did tip well as the bartenders and servers don’t deserve to be penalized for bad management. But it made me feel icky and sad AND COLD while spending $300. Not ideal. It was a 40 degree night…. Blatantly disrespectful

Customer 518.Name: ShielaG
Customer 518.Content: Second visit to Niku. The food, the ambience, and the service are all top notch! Would come back again!

Customer 519.Name: Cyairab
Customer 519.Content: The most amazing elegant restaurant from the ambience to the delicious food . Everyone who works at this establishment was very polite , helpful and inviting . They did such a great job showing us the different wagyu meats available the presentation was great . Chef was amazing . A really great resturant highly recommend the a5 bushu-gyu and the bone marrow as an appetizer as well as the crispy potatoes and wagyu brownie for dessert to die for ! Definitely coming back they showed us a great time at Niku !

Customer 520.Name: Alex
Customer 520.Content:
The ambience upon entering and the food was amazing from start to finish.

For starters, we got the flavorful and rich beef tartare and bone marrow, combined with the crispy pig ears.
For the main course, we got the A5 bushu-gyu which was definitely our favorite of the night in terms of taste. Whether or not it's worth its high price point is debatable but we had no regrets trying it. We also got the tomahawk and Bryan flannery dry aged new york strip which were both cooked to perfection.
Then we finished the night with the sticky toffee cake and wagyu fat brownie, which were again both delicious but not sure if it was worth the price.

Overall, we had a great experience and would be willing to come back.

Customer 521.Name: Bunny
Customer 521.Content:
The A5 tasting seems overpriced. It didn't have a wow factor, probably because one of us had tasted the original A5 beef in Japan. I feel the price is more for the service and single source import from a Japanese farm. We got the off menu item $440 for 9oz total, 3 types of A5, shared between two people. It's a little over seasoned, texture is 4/5. Service is 3/5, there were many waiters walking around but they are not super attentive. There were 3 times that I wanted service and waited for more than a few minutes. For the price point I was expecting Michelin level service because the bill came out as a 3 star Michelin restaurant but after 2.5 hours of dining I was disappointed. We have waited for more than an hour to get the first taste of the dishes. 

I like the sides and appetizers more than the main course. I would give the small dishes 4.5/5, nice flavors with a reasonable price. I am still interested in other types of Janapense Wagu they serve so that my review is not biased. Since the most expensive ones are not that impressive, but it's good enough for me to return to try other items on the menu.

Customer 522.Name: ForrestG
Customer 522.Content:
The bone marrow appetizer was incredible and they even brought out some crispy tendon for my gluten sensitive date....which was an amazing alternative to the toasted sourdough.

You must also order the potato side.

Staff was very friendly!

The high tops are adequate but not quite as nice as the tables in the main dining room.

Customer 523.Name: ShreyanM
Customer 523.Content: Food was great and the servers are really good. However, I felt the portions suggestions per person were a bit inaccurate.

Customer 524.Name: RoseR
Customer 524.Content: Food was delicious and presented well. Seating was comfortable. Service was good, but our waiter missed one of our wyagu dishes and forgot or didn’t acknowledge our reason for being there, which was for a milestone birthday celebration. We did order dessert tho.

Customer 525.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 525.Content: This place is my go to for anniversaries or a date night with my love. The staff treats us so well from top down! Will be going here again later this year for our anniversary.

Customer 526.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 526.Content: Great food and great staff. Will come back again.

Customer 527.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 527.Content: We took our friends here to celebrate their birthdays. The A5 sampler is a must. Everything on the menu is delicious. The recommendations by the team were really good and paired perfectly to make our experience so lovely.

Customer 528.Name: Tanger
Customer 528.Content: Food is delicious! Steak is amazing.  Drinks were decent, smaller pour than other places for the price. Tables were a bit too close together. Grill front bar type seating looked good.  Going to have to try that next time.

Customer 529.Name: Tara
Customer 529.Content: We had an early evening reservation for 2 - loved our seat and the experience overall. Loved the tasting menu experience and flavors - would recommend for all.

Customer 530.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 530.Content: They treated us very special for our 20th anniversary and my husband’s birthday!  Food was amazing, service was superb!

Customer 531.Name: RHay
Customer 531.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful dinner at Nuku’s celebrating our anniversary. Great food and service.

Customer 532.Name: Yuri
Customer 532.Content: The food was delicious!!! Service was great, overall amazing experience. Appetizers and drinks came out really fast, however we waited over an hour for our main dish.

Customer 533.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 533.Content:
Top , tutto molto bene.
Servizio, qualità del cibo, gestione dei tempi.
Drink perfetto.

Customer 534.Name: Nikhil
Customer 534.Content: Amazing. Every single aspect of the meal was carefully curated

Customer 535.Name: ChinhN
Customer 535.Content: Sit at the counter to get the full experience, as you watch the chef prepare your delicious and mouthwatering steak on the open wood fire grill.  Just be careful not to burn a hole in your pants pocket.

Customer 536.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 536.Content: Totally overpriced and my $115 6oz filet came out over cooked and lukewarm. Dessert was good. Sit in the bar or back by fire. The middle tables make you feel like you’re at an Applebees. For a place that has a $235 6oz cut of Waygu i feel like the ambiance would be significantly better and more high end.

Customer 537.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 537.Content: The Wagu short ribs should come with a warning.  I had no issue with the fantastic preparation, the amazing chefs, or our fabulous service - and yes I am well aware of what Wagu is and how it is made..  that said it was SO pure fat that both myself and my dinner partner could not get through more than 3 pieces and we both spent the rest of the evening ahem* clearing it from our systems throughout the night.  That was a hard note to land on for a $300 dinner for 2.    I mean I am aware it’s a delicacy but at a certain point If one finds out that is how most diners are going to experience their food…I am certain we are not the only people that have had this experience…then one might rethink the serving size or perhaps offer a gentle warning to their customer.   This is very rich not all people do well with that …

Customer 538.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 538.Content: Waited 1 h and 40 min for food. To pricey compared to what you get. Not that innovative

Customer 539.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 539.Content: I went to Niku to celebrate my anniversary with my partner. They provided excellent service to truly make our night wonderful. This included a handwritten note celebrating our anniversary as well as customized menus that also congratulated our anniversary. Service was amazing and the food was delicious. I would definitely recommend anyone to come try this restaurant.

Customer 540.Name: Neil
Customer 540.Content: Loved everything about Niku! Best steaks in SF, period.

Customer 541.Name: pattiA
Customer 541.Content: The restaurant is beautiful but extremely loud.   We had a party of 6 and could not visit with each other.  They left the door open for circulation and it was extremely cold.  The food was fair, nothing outstanding.  We prefer other locations in San Francisco to this.  Disappointing for the expensive price.

Customer 542.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 542.Content: Fantastic food and service at a high price!

Customer 543.Name: jordan
Customer 543.Content: everything was amazing but it was hard to understand the sizing of the steak portions. we ordered the short rib and filet mignon thinking that wouldn't be enough. But when the short rib came it was big enough for 2-3 people. Other than that everything was amazing.

Customer 544.Name: AudreyBonneval
Customer 544.Content:
Très bonne expérience.
Service impeccable et attentionné.
Idéalement, pensez à réserver votre table au comptoir.
Nous avons passés un agréable moment.

Customer 545.Name: DesiA
Customer 545.Content: amazing second experience! the food is superb. the staff  is attentive, courteous, professional and very accommodating. we are very impressed. will be back again soon. all in all - our favorite steakhouse at the moment.

Customer 546.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 546.Content: Service was dreadful. Totally overpriced and so noisy!! Suggest going to Mastros! 10 x better

Customer 547.Name: hachi
Customer 547.Content: Black cod was over cooked, just as the A5 wagyu on previous visit was overcooked.  Pasta was great.  Service was very good.  Door should be cracked open for ventilation as it gets warm especially near the grill, also for covid reasons.

Customer 548.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 548.Content: Truly amazing experience and service! We celebrated our wedding anniversary here and both of us agree that the food was probably the best we’ve ever tried (and we have been to many fine dining restaurants). The service staff were always attentive, we had an amazing view of the grill, and savored every single bite. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a Michelin star restaurant but cannot finish all those courses! What an amazing highlight to our San Francisco trip.

Customer 549.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 549.Content: Excellent! From the hostess to the waitress to the owner coming by for a personal table side visit, this place was (and is) fantastic!!!!!! Yum!!!!!!

Customer 550.Name: AnnW
Customer 550.Content: Every dish we had was delicious!  We celebrated a family birthday with a party of six and  we shared everything family style so got to taste many dishes.  Our favorites were the short ribs and crispy pig ears, but all were tasty and expertly prepared.  Service was top-notch.  Will definitely be back.

Customer 552.Name: JacopoR
Customer 552.Content: Beautiful location, greet food! The choice of knives fantastic!

Customer 554.Name: AndreaD
Customer 554.Content: Exceptional wagyu selection, a must if you like Japanese meat

Customer 555.Name: RickP
Customer 555.Content: Amazing food, wine, service and ambiance. Was a highlight of our SF visit.

Customer 556.Name: lauriew
Customer 556.Content: Outstanding. Cool vibe. Amazing service and food. Highly recommend!

Customer 557.Name: Catty
Customer 557.Content: The service was good but the food was ok, we liked the side better lol. Overall feel like it just overpriced :(

Customer 558.Name: hachi
Customer 558.Content: The A5 which was supposed to be medium rare arrived medium-well.  The bone marrow did not have much marrow.  The servers had a difficult time explaining the drinks.

Customer 559.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 559.Content: Came for the steak which turned out to be the worst dish. The cocktails were tasty. The pig ears were a great crunchy appetizer. The tartar lacked flavor. The tomahawk steak was chewy, difficult to cut, and had a lot of inedible fat. Was very disappointed with the steak quality.

Customer 560.Name: ByungK
Customer 560.Content:
Anniversary dinner, service and quality was superb.  Ordered the A5 Waygu, a must if your going to Niku.  Recommendation is unless your sharing, get the 4oz/smaller order unless your stomach can handle the richness of the true waygu beef.

Would go again for special occasions.

Customer 561.Name: Jeff
Customer 561.Content: The wagyu steak was amazing, definitely a great place to go if you're looking to splurge for a special occasion to have some of the best steak you'll ever eat. Excellent service as well.

Customer 563.Name: RoyK
Customer 563.Content: Good is great, but the prices are quite high.  Just be prepared if you order A5 Wagyu.

Customer 564.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 564.Content: Everyone encountered was very friendly. Pace of meal was agonizingly slow. No one took real ownership of the table. No check backs, no refills on soda, even with the glass on the side of the table in view. Yes, I would eat here again.

Customer 565.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 565.Content:
Attentive staffs
Amazing food
Atmosphere was modern 
Anniversary Dinner was memorable

Customer 566.Name: JudithL
Customer 566.Content:
Our experience at Niku this past Sunday was delightful.  The presentation and taste of the appetizers, especially the Bone Marrow, were pleasingly flavorful.

Our entrees, the Black Cod and Ribeye Cap, were cooked to perfection.  The fish was moist and the meat was tasty and tender.

The staff was very attentive and provided detailed information about how each dish was sourced and prepared.

We could definitely see why Niku met the rigid standards of being a Michelin restaurant in 2021.

Customer 567.Name: SamanthaS
Customer 567.Content:
Second time at Niku. 

Birthday dinner. Loved the front bar area and bartenders. 
Ordered the tartare which was the best thing all night. 
Ordered the A5 Bushu-gyu quite good, slightly over cooked. 

Ordered the tomahawk…will not order again. Almost half was fat and was inedible. The knives couldn’t even cut most pieces of the steak. 

I’ve tried almost ever side on the menu at this point, and I have learned my lesson, the sides just aren’t worth it. The mushrooms were cold and very smoky, fun and funky but didn’t add much to the meal. The tomatoes were inedible from my view, every-time I took a bite I wanted to like it but it was like I was eating a fireplace. 

The brownie is very good but I need to order the Miso ice cream in the side as the salt from the ice cream is overwhelming.

Not the restaurants fault but the table next to us were some of the most obnoxious diners I’ve ever eaten next to in a fine dining restaurant, one of the patrons even apologized to us at the end of the meal.

Customer 568.Name: CoastalK
Customer 568.Content: Ember-roasting plus seasoning elevated the steaks to the most flavorful meal I’ve ever had.  Great service. Unique cocktails.  An outstanding and unique experience.

Customer 569.Name: Pete
Customer 569.Content: Without question, the best steakhouse I have ever been to.

Customer 570.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 570.Content: Good steak and service. Highly recommended!

Customer 571.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 571.Content: Took so long to get anything done - was not meant to be a four hour dinner but the waiter was slow and not super responsive!

Customer 572.Name: RyanF
Customer 572.Content: This was an amazing meal.  Five stars.

Customer 573.Name: Thrillhouse
Customer 573.Content: This could very well be my new favorite steak experience in the SF Bay Area. Everything from top to bottom was exceptional. We got the little gem salad, soft shell crab and oysters and the presentation was food magazine perfect. Everything was so delicious we just wanted to order a second helping of our appetizers. Then came our steaks and cod. We got the NY strip and rib eye cap and both had very unique flavors and were perfectly cooked. The cod was like a fish had died, gone to fish heaven and came back down as an angel on our plate. So silky and buttery in texture and flavor. We had a side of rice that was better than I expected. Tastes almost like sushi rice with nicely sized chunks of eggplant. Then we wrapped things up with the wagyu brownie. Not sure what I was expecting but oh man we were glad to have ordered it. I will definitely be coming back to Niku and recommending it to friends and family.

Customer 574.Name: Michael
Customer 574.Content:
Our experience at Niku was great with introduction to different types of steaks from its Wagyu selection to other cuts. The starters and side dishes we ordered were great. However, there was an issue where the server didn't correctly take our order as we didn't get one of our main entrees. We've ordered the a5 tasting menu to go along with the new york strip. The server actually brought out the different cuts to show us the different sizes which led to us changing our mind from ordering the ribeye midcap to the strip. 

Unfortunately, our server did not catch our order and we were left with only the tasting menu for the night which left us quite hungry. It was a late reservation, so as we started to see the chefs packing things up, we knew something was wrong. When our server came around to check on us, it was way too late to remedy the issue. We were offered desserts or coffee in exchange, but at that point, we were just hungry so that offer was not something that we were interested in. We ended our night finding a late night pizza place for a slice. Definitely not how I expected the night to end when taking someone from out of town to SF fine dining. 

Normally, I don't think we would mind such a mistake, but for a restaurant of this calibre and missing out on one of the main entree (1 or 2) for what the restaurant is known for, is a bit disappointing.

Customer 575.Name: JohnW
Customer 575.Content:
Food was good overall, very rich but that was to be expected. Went to celebrate my wife's birthday and we let the restaurant know twice. Table next to us received a complimentary dessert with a candle but we received nothing. Kind of hard to imagine paying nearly $500 for a dinner for two and not having the bare minimum effort.

They seemed more interested in selling their high end A5 meats

Customer 576.Name: foodluver
Customer 576.Content: Elegant, pricey, good service and great for special occasions.

Customer 577.Name: Cassie
Customer 577.Content: Unfortunately did not live up to expectations. Food was mostly great (meatballs, bone marrow, salad- steak was good for the cut we purchased, and they kindly noted an occasion with a small dessert) but marred by severely lacking service- which was slow, inattentive, and overall very poor quality. Would strongly not recommend for a special occasion. By far, this was unfortunately a very poor dining experiences for value to price.

Customer 579.Name: RachelM
Customer 579.Content:
I booked dinner here to celebrate my partner’s 34th birthday. The food was delicious from the salad to dessert. The drinks were delectable. Even the playlist of background music was on point. Our server was helpful and friendly. They even allowed us to take a pick from a selection of knives for our steaks. Finally they had the sweet touch of bringing out a cupcake and candle for the birthday boy. Complete with a card that came in a wax sealed envelope. 

Obviously the meal was quite expensive but it’s what we expected and the quality of the experience was worth it.

Customer 580.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 580.Content: An awesome steakhouse that exceeds your expectations

Customer 581.Name: WendyA
Customer 581.Content:
Portion size far too big, starters very good, meet very tasty but far too much, accompaniments limited and poor, overall disappointing.
This would not get a Mechlin star in the uk.
Music loud, difficult to hear and understand staff particularly with the addition of facemasks. (I completely understand and support facemasks, but music needs to be quieter when they are worn)

Customer 582.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 582.Content: Great food and service.   They prepare the A5 Wagyu just like Japan

Customer 583.Name: Markr
Customer 583.Content: Loved it. Very nice place to go for a special occasion. We liked every dish we ordered.

Customer 584.Name: Wmlwml
Customer 584.Content: Great service, excellent food. I think we were a bit overwhelmed by the tomahawk, and maybe next time would order more sides/apps.

Customer 585.Name: SuperMan
Customer 585.Content: Like to sitting at kitchen counter and watching the cook preparing the meat .. the servers was great !! Had a great time last night

Customer 586.Name: AlessandroA
Customer 586.Content:
The meat is good but where is the passion in the plate?
Too cold in the inside room .
Service very good.

Customer 587.Name: designerwithchopsticks
Customer 587.Content: Visited this Dog Patch neighborhood gem. I've been to the Butcher house so I knew the food would be top notch, so I chose to go for my birthday. The place is full of smiling staff, the interior is modern-cool, we chose the counter so we can see the chefs do their magic. Everything on the menu (we ordered) were just right, try for yourselves, and accompany them with proper drinks (pinot for us). The staff service was excellent: Attentive, but never annoying. Received a small cupcake at the end with a note. Great experience, recommend. Thanks.

Customer 589.Name: JanVincent
Customer 589.Content:
The restaurant was fairly busy for a Monday night and I sat at the counter. It was cramped especially with other guests constantly leaning over. 

I sat for a good 10 minutes before my waitress acknowledged me and asked me if I needed anything. If it wasn’t for a knowledgeable guest I was sitting beside I would not have figured out what to order. The service did not seem consistent as other guests were shown the steak options but I was not. Don’t know why. 

The food at least was exceptional and kudos to the chefs because they are keeping this place open. The Wagyu was cooked perfectly and is a testament to the chefs skills given it’s cooked over wood flame. Great culinary experience. However, wagyu isn’t cheap and the portion size is rather small. Be prepared to load up on other food if you come here hungry. A wagyu steak alone will not cut it. 

All in all I enjoyed the food but I would not go out of my way to come back here the next time I visit SF.

Customer 590.Name: DesiA
Customer 590.Content:
Great first impression! We will be back for sure. 
Bit crowded at the counter. Remove one chair or two to give diners elbow and shoulder space. We were uncomfortablly crammed with others rubbing elbows while cutting our steak. 

Other than that food and service were great. Kudos.

Customer 591.Name: RobinR
Customer 591.Content: Just excellent food and service. Top notch everything.

Customer 592.Name: Ashley
Customer 592.Content:
Not worth the money. We all ended up eating sick after and I took home the leftovers and gave some to my dog — he even got sick. 

We tried to order two different bottles of wine and they didn’t have either of them. It took them 40 mins to locate a bottle of wine (which the didn’t even locate and brought us a random one) by the time we finally got our wine we were almost done with our steak.

Granted— it will say our server was great. She was super nice and explained things well. But I will say not worth spending $200 a steak. I have had much better that didn’t make me sick for cheaper.

Customer 593.Name: AnitaM
Customer 593.Content: The best experience ever, everything was great and tasty! Will be back soon :)

Customer 595.Name: EliseL
Customer 595.Content:
Excellent food--from the appetizers to the entrees to dessert. Service is top notch.  
Highly recommend sitting at the chef's counter and watching the action up close.

Customer 596.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 596.Content:
It was great but not too much value for money.
Thought the wine / sake selection there wasn’t as great either

Customer 597.Name: Joshua
Customer 597.Content: This was my second time eating at Niku. The service was not up to par on this visit. We had to wait 20 minutes to be seated. They also forgot one of our steak orders. Food was excellent as expected but the service was a little off this time. I expected better for the amount of $ I spent on dinner.

Customer 598.Name: KatyP
Customer 598.Content: I have had the luxury of eating at multiple 1-Michelin star restaurants in SF. I’m shocked Niku doesn’t have more than one star. Everything was exceptional. Definitely one of the best restaurants I have ever been to.

Customer 599.Name: Fred
Customer 599.Content: Outstanding place. Great food and cocktails. It very well deserves the Michelin star.

Customer 600.Name: StpH
Customer 600.Content: The wagyu is incredible. The rice is a good side to accompany. Tomahawk was good, although it couldn't compare to the A5.

Customer 601.Name: ButtzNasty
Customer 601.Content: Niku is fantastic, They are a very attentive staff. If you get the chance always sit at the counter and engage with their chefs. A truly elite dining experience.

Customer 602.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 602.Content: AH-MAZING!!!! My date and I thoroughly enjoyed it!! Mind blowing food and outstanding service.

Customer 604.Name: Haven
Customer 604.Content: Some of the best beef I’ve ever had; every dish at or near perfection; practically flawless service; an excellent candidate to celebrate or flex

Customer 605.Name: Jade
Customer 605.Content: Niku steakhouse has a very intimate setting that is sleek. The service fell short because the music was a bit lout and we could hardly hear what our waiters were saying at times. Although the food was absolutely amazing.

Customer 606.Name: TamaraH
Customer 606.Content: The food was awesome so was the service I would go back in a heartbeat.. Told all our friends we loved it

Customer 607.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 607.Content: Overpriced for sure. The food is just okay and we were quite disappointed.

Customer 608.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 608.Content: Food was excellent and so was the service. Would definitely recommend! Best steak I’ve ever had!

Customer 609.Name: Jaee
Customer 609.Content: We had a great time for a birthday celebration.  We wish they have more selections of steaks.

Customer 610.Name: Chino
Customer 610.Content: Great food. Great service. Steaks are out of this world.

Customer 611.Name: GailW
Customer 611.Content: It was amazing. The food, cocktails, ambiance, and service were impeccable. Gorgeous space and every bite of food will make you melt. Come here for a treat or to impress.

Customer 613.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 613.Content: Chefs table was awesome and the service incredible. Now the food was even better than those two put together.

Customer 614.Name: RavenUs
Customer 614.Content:
I LOVED the dinner and drinks at Niku, extremely tasty and worth the money.

However, I'm disappointed to share that my friend and I had a lot of trouble getting service, either from our waitress to take our order, for her to check on us (we wanted to order more: another drink and a piece of steak) for which along with waiting an additional 30 minutes to receive the meat element, no one brought us my drink while we waited. 

I would go back, but not as soon as I might otherwise due to this service snaffoo.

Customer 615.Name: ZUKE
Customer 615.Content:
Our waiter was top notch 
Extremely knowledgeable about the Wagu beef history and where our food came from 
Very exciting APPs and service excellent 
It may be pricey but for a fantastic special meal 
Phenomenal !!!!!!!

Customer 616.Name: TomS
Customer 616.Content: One of our favorites in SF.  We have been several times now, and enjoy sitting at the bar for both food and great cocktails.  Both bar tenders are awesome, super knowledgeable about not only the specialty drinks of the restaurant, but the vast selection of liquor, wine and beer as well as mix drinks in general.  They also give us great food recommendations, and everything we've had so far has exceeded our expectations.  Amazing food, great flavors, attention to details and presentation.

Customer 617.Name: MichaelT
Customer 617.Content: Nikki was amazing . The food was to die for. Had the a5 taster which was amazing along with a few other dishes . The sutsumi (not sure if this is correct spelling) a5 steak literally melted in your mouth . Absolutely amazing . All the servers and bartenders were also really knowledgeable on their drinks and food choices. I wish I had reserved seats earlier because I reserved a little too late and didn’t get to experience sitting in the main dining area. I was at a high top next to the bar so the ambiance wasn’t the greatest especially since I was at the table closest to the entrance. Otherwise , the place was great and they even gave us some free cupcakes since I was celebrating my anniversary with my fiancé. Will definitely come back for the next special occasion I have !!

Customer 618.Name: KB20
Customer 618.Content: Lovely atmosphere. Great place to spend quality time.

Customer 620.Name: Keith
Customer 620.Content: Love the place…thanks for all you do for the clients!

Customer 621.Name: LaMarM
Customer 621.Content: Seated promptly.  Attention was paid to every step of service

Customer 622.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 622.Content: Everything about Niku was wonderful, from the food to the service. 10/10 would recommend to celebrate a special occasion

Customer 623.Name: Human
Customer 623.Content:
Food is good but still overpriced. Dining room is a bit stuffed and noisy. Manager (we assume) was very rude and came off as pretentious. They brought a dish we didn't order, then convinced us to keep it and try it, and then added it to the bill. Bad practice.

Glad we went and checked it off the list but it will not be a regular part of the rotation.

Customer 624.Name: fishball
Customer 624.Content: The food was great! You definitely have to save room for the Brownie at the end of the meal.

Customer 625.Name: FrancoiseG
Customer 625.Content: Dat wor dat beschte Fleesch wat ech je a mengem Liewe gies hun. Einfach genial. An et muss een um Comptoir setzen…that’s a must

Customer 626.Name: LiangZ
Customer 626.Content:
they did not pay attention when we order 

forget to order the to go food 

forget to bring the side and still bill to us until we point it out

Customer 627.Name: Budducci
Customer 627.Content: The dining here was amazing. I sat at the chef’s table right at the grill.  The service was very attentive and did a great job of explaining Wagyu as well as the other dishes and helped me choose complementary sides. All the food was cooked to perfection and I savored every morsel.

Customer 628.Name: RobinR
Customer 628.Content: Just phenomenal meal and service. Franco, head of the bar, is fantastic!

Customer 629.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 629.Content: Ehh. Service was awkward and rude.

Customer 631.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 631.Content: Went here for a my Bachelor dinner. The experience, service and quality of the meats was exceptional.

Customer 632.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 632.Content: Amazing food and service! Best restaurant experience we’ve had this year!

Customer 633.Name: Patrick
Customer 633.Content: Food and experience was amazing as expected!

Customer 634.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 634.Content: Amazing restaurant, would definitely return! We arrived on time and then were promptly seated at our high top lounge table. We liked this seat as it was right next to some clear glass windows that gave us a peek into their butchery next door and it felt like one of the more private seatings in the restaurant. The food was excellent as expected: we ordered the steak tartare, bone marrow, a5 sampler, and the wagyu filet mignon. The a5 sampler came with 2 cuts of wagyu, 4oz of each. The wagyu filet mignon was 8oz and my favorite of all the cuts since it was on the leaner side. We also had a side of the Parker rolls which we inhaled since they were so good even without the actual butter it came with. For dessert we had the black sesame ice cream and coffee for 2 which was the perfect way to end our meal.

Customer 635.Name: TalyaS
Customer 635.Content: Absolutely incredible meal here. Delicious food and wonderful service.

Customer 636.Name: StevenC
Customer 636.Content: Applause to Rachel, Courtney, and Chris for making our night an unforgettable experience!

Customer 637.Name: Allie
Customer 637.Content: Food and service was great. Prices were a bit higher than similar high end steakhouses in SF but we did enjoy our dining experience.

Customer 638.Name: HannahD
Customer 638.Content: Niku is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. The food and the service are top notch. If you go you have to sit at the chef's counter!

Customer 639.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 639.Content: Food and service was excellent. Music was a little loud.

Customer 640.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 640.Content: Truly exceptional, special A5 served by good people who are thoughtful in their service.

Customer 641.Name: MariE
Customer 641.Content: I normally don't write reviews because everyone has there own standards but Niku is amazing.  Pricey? Yes but the food, the services and overall experience is worth every cent.  Each plate was heaven.

Customer 642.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 642.Content: Fantastic! Best meal of my life!

Customer 643.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 643.Content: Perfectly timed service with attention to detail. Ambient with the ideal amounts of lighting and hushed conversation. Food was spot on and the red wine was decanted and served at the perfect temperature. We have already made our next reservation to entertain friends at Niku.

Customer 644.Name: RoyK
Customer 644.Content: Great food, overpriced, small side dishes, average service

Customer 645.Name: SusanP
Customer 645.Content:
Niku does not fail, food was delicious!  Our server Ivana was 
excellent, she anticipated our needs and provided us with
great service.

Customer 646.Name: OceanE
Customer 646.Content: Staff is gracious and accommodating. Food is high quality and good portion size. A value compared to other single star Michelin restaurants in SF. Often times I order a pizza after a microscopic meal. Not so at Niku!

Customer 647.Name: luv2Cfood
Customer 647.Content: Father’s Day dinner with my daughter.

Customer 648.Name: LReader
Customer 648.Content: Meticulous, marvelous preparation and cooking techniques that elevate the intense complex flavors of beef, a protein source seemingly so mundane at times in our daily lives.  Every bite was delicious.  We also greatly enjoyed the Niku butcher shop next door.  Thank you (!) to all of the staff at Niku for our special experience.

Customer 649.Name: FoodieSF
Customer 649.Content: Early Father’s Day dinner. Everything was superb from the meal to the service to the ambience. Will definitely return.

Customer 650.Name: Stefan
Customer 650.Content: The bushu-gyu  is worth all the money, our waiter was a bit condescending and the dessert was ok-ish and average overall experience but will still recommend going there.

Customer 651.Name: CharlesN
Customer 651.Content: The food here was amazing and the attention to detail was impressive. Would highly recommend this establishment to anyone looking for fine dining and great A5 Wagyu experience.

Customer 652.Name: minmmk
Customer 652.Content:
Amazing experience 
Food was great
Service was great
Their cocktails were great
A definite must try destination

Customer 653.Name: AlohaRobyn
Customer 653.Content:
Anniversary dinner was spectacular 🥰🤩

Niku served the most exquisite meal- bone marrow with spare ribs, beer battered soft shell crab, and a 21 day dry aged New York steak. For dessert- wagu fat brownie with wagu fat caramel. Our tastebuds exploded with every bite! 

The best way to end the perfect anniversary celebration. The service was amazing. Being seated at the counter we got a front row seat on watching how a lot of the food was prepared which was such an amazing experience. Can’t wait to come back and have another wonderful experience.

Customer 654.Name: Carnivorical
Customer 654.Content: Lovely experience, perfect for an anniversary or other special occasion. Order the a5 tasting and the bone marrow, you won't be disappointed.

Customer 655.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 655.Content: We were celebrating a belated birthday party for a family friend (teenager’s bday). We were dining as a family of 5 and had great servers and the sommelier was also helpful and nice. We spent nearly $1k on dinner and were very disappointed with who we assumed to be the management team in suits. We were rushed to pay our bill and made to feel less than welcome and very judged since we were casually dressed for a 5 pm reservation and our boys were also casually attired.  Everything was great other than the presence of these managers who clearly judged us to be not good enough for their restaurant. It’s too bad since the food and other service was great but not sure I can support management like this. Note, we also decided to go to this restaurant because our son learned about it through a school assignment about minority owned businesses including this one and dumpling time.  Is a fine dining restaurant and you better dress the part or be treated as someone not deserving.

Customer 656.Name: AllanZ
Customer 656.Content: outstanding food prepared with exquisite attention to detail - tastes like heaven.

Customer 657.Name: TranB
Customer 657.Content: Love the service! But after getting home, our stomach feels a little bit off. Other than that, everything’s perfect! We had beef tartare, bone marrow, and a5 tasting!

Customer 658.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 658.Content: I go here where I get a chance and they make me feel like no one else is in the restaurant. Services are that good.

Customer 659.Name: Arnet
Customer 659.Content: Lovely steak, lovely service. Also, lovely whiskey.

Customer 660.Name: ShawnK
Customer 660.Content: I am not a steak connoisseur but for me it was the unquestionably the best steak I have ever tried

Customer 661.Name: tt33
Customer 661.Content: All the food we ordered was amazing, very flavorful. The steak was perfect. The didn’t over season it so you could actually taste the meat. Service was attentive but unobtrusive. The courses were spaced out so as not to feel rushed, but we also weren’t left waiting. Overall, no complaints.

Customer 662.Name: Krikor
Customer 662.Content: It lives up to its reputation. Without a doubt the best steakhouse in the bay area.

Customer 663.Name: JacquelineL
Customer 663.Content: Niku is always excellent. And always impresses. A perfect choice for both friends & business.

Customer 664.Name: TonyL
Customer 664.Content: Really exceptional. Fantastic experience. Highly recommended.

Customer 665.Name: FoodieJen
Customer 665.Content: Great food. Almost everything on the menu is a must as far as we tried. Service was amazing. Chef's Counter is the place to be. Fun place, great environment, impeccable service. Highly recommend.

Customer 666.Name: caligem23
Customer 666.Content: Amazing experience at Niku! The a5 tasting was exceptional along with the white asparagus dish and pig ears. The staff was kind and attentive as well. What a special restaurant!

Customer 668.Name: Evangeline
Customer 668.Content: Great. Definitely worth trying. I would love to come back when i visit SF again.

Customer 669.Name: John
Customer 669.Content: All the appetizers were super delicious. The only thing I would like is some veggies to go with the steak because it’s hard just eating steak itself. Other than that everything was good. Definitely would of come back.

Customer 670.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 670.Content: Disappointed with the new chef. Old chef A5 was unforgettable but my home-cooked steaks from Costco are better than the new chef’s offering.

Customer 671.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 671.Content: Best steakhouse we have ever been to. Definitely recommend!

Customer 673.Name: gotgswtix
Customer 673.Content: Party of four, we've been to Niku twice in the past 2 weeks prior. We had a 915pm reservation and four of us had to wait 30-40 minutes before being seated. Dinner was excellent, service was a bit lacking this time. I was handed a wine menu that was empty twice, we had more services from Rachel the som last time when we brought our own bottle of wine vs. this night. As we finished up dinner, we also noticed there was still wine left in our bottle... overall food was great, service could have been improved and different experience than the last two times. I hope this feedback helps.

Customer 674.Name: JoanneC
Customer 674.Content: I don’t think I’ve ever been to a restaurant with better service than Niku. Best thing we ordered was the crispy pig ears, morel tortellini, black sesame ice cream. The tomahawk steak was cooked perfectly, but lacked some flavor. Halibut also didn’t have too much flavor and wasn’t memorable. Wagyu meatball was super soft, borderline mushy. Bone marrow could’ve been roasted more.

Customer 675.Name: RachaelZ
Customer 675.Content: I have a hard time eating out as a chef due to being to critical. This is possibly the best meal I have ever had. Server was very detailed with explaining what the food was and how it played together/flavor profiles. They made our anniversary feel special and we can express how much we loved everything. Every bite was delicious and cocktails were perfectly mixed.

Customer 676.Name: Christiank
Customer 676.Content: The food was really good! They gave really good recommendations for drinks/food.

Customer 677.Name: SheivaY
Customer 677.Content: Impeccable service and very deserving of the Michelin Star

Customer 678.Name: Shell
Customer 678.Content: The food was better than what we expected. All our servers were great, attentive, super friendly and helped make our experience a memorable one. Definitely would come again.

Customer 679.Name: Matthew
Customer 679.Content: Overpriced. Steak was mediocre. Apps were decent though.

Customer 680.Name: KeithC
Customer 680.Content: Seating at counter was tight and too hot from fire pit. Very surprised the cooks are not wearing masks. Meat cook touching meat with her bare hands then rubbing her sweat from neck and forehead was disgusting.

Customer 681.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 681.Content: Eric was an absolute pleasure and was very conscious of our time since we had a show to get to. In the end we spent more time with him and on our dining experience since he made it so wonderful. The presentation of all the food and having the opportunity to sit next to the grill was awesome. Thanks again for everything!

Customer 682.Name: KennyD
Customer 682.Content:
Excellent service and food. The asparagus with a horse radish sabayon prepared by Irene was heaven. Such a great dining experience. 

Had the Australian tomahawk steak was prepared perfectly. I like mine charred rare. 

And the pig ear starter was definitely enjoyed by us.

Lemon Meyer tart and black sesame ice cream was a perfect ending to a great dining experience.

Definitely a place to try and enjoy.

Customer 683.Name: jargond
Customer 683.Content: By far, my favorite steakhouse in SF!  Absolutely loved the food and service!!

Customer 684.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 684.Content: Ask the wait staff all the questions you want! They are so knowledgeable

Customer 685.Name: BoscoN
Customer 685.Content:
Amazing service and experience. I would recommend to anyone looking for an up scale top notch steak house that delivers on all aspects. 

The Niku team was very engaging and the food was excellent. Hats off to the chef.

Customer 686.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 686.Content: Our evening at Niku Steakhouse was perfection. The food and service were impeccable. If you get the chance to sit at the chef’s counter - do it! Can’t recommend this restaurant enough.

Customer 687.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 687.Content: Amazing experience! We were very well taken care of and the food was delicious! I would recommend this for any special occasion or date night!

Customer 688.Name: ChristinaW
Customer 688.Content: The food was outstanding.  I had the dry aged ribeye and waygu fat potatoes.

Customer 689.Name: richnguyen
Customer 689.Content: The food was incredible and the service was amazing. We ordered family style and each dish had specific and unique flavors. The staff were very friendly and accommodating.

Customer 690.Name: ChristiH
Customer 690.Content: I was impressed with how friendly and pleasant each and every person was. The experience exceeded my expectations.  The attention to detail was apparent in everything. The food was amazing. Thank you!

Customer 691.Name: CarmenP
Customer 691.Content: Amazing food in a beautiful setting. We sat at the counter by the fire and chatted with the lovely staff. It's pricey but it's worth it!

Customer 693.Name: Cody
Customer 693.Content: The best food I have ever had. Wonderful service. Everyone explained everything so I felt comfortable with my order

Customer 694.Name: Elwood
Customer 694.Content: I enjoyed the food as well as the drinks. The staff were very friendly and made great recommendations on food

Customer 695.Name: AsianQueen
Customer 695.Content: Discovered this gem for a delicious steak dinner for two or family. The wagyu steak was out of this world. I also love the rib eye cap. The service was exceptional! I high recommend.

Customer 696.Name: EgonZehnder
Customer 696.Content: Hands down the best restaurant I’ve ever been to. Pricey but worth every penny.

Customer 697.Name: jhPa
Customer 697.Content: Most times I go it's satisfactory food and service however service was the only thing amiable this time around. The servers are always on point and never miss a beat. However the steak and times for food to cook took forever. Not only that the steak was tough and not well marbled. Most times I've gone everything has been on point but this time around it was ok

Customer 698.Name: Samantha
Customer 698.Content: The food, service, and ambience were incredible. Such a lovely experience.

Customer 699.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 699.Content: This was our first time here for a birthday celebration. Doors didn’t open until exactly 5pm. We got seated right away once the door opened and we sat at the chefs table. Enjoyed watching them cook the food. They will talk to you if they have down time to check how things are going. Servers are super friendly and attentive. Someone constantly checked up on us to make sure we were doing ok.

Customer 700.Name: StephanieH
Customer 700.Content: Amazing food and service!! Easily one of the best steakhouses in SF!

Customer 701.Name: ThomasF
Customer 701.Content: Excellent food, short rib, beet salad, crispy potatoes, bone marrow and buckwheat parker house rolls were all delicious. The wagyu wasn't as good as the rest, pretty good, mild flavor/not very strong, and it wasn't very hot by the time it reached us. (just warm, not hot).  All in all, I'd go again for sure.

Customer 702.Name: Happyberry
Customer 702.Content:
Overall great experience! We were seated at the center of the chef's table, able to watch the meats and appetizers get prepared. Everyone at the restaurant made sure all the details were as perfect as they can be.
We ordered the bone marrow (our favorite!), crispy pig ears, and halibut credo for appetizers, the A5 wagyu sampler for the main and peas as a side, and the strawberry tart and sesame ice cream desserts paired with teas (recommend the oolong tea! Floral in scent and slightly sweet).
I'd recommend sitting at the counter if you're a party of two, as it's a lot of fun to watch the dishes get prepared.

Customer 703.Name: uhohsid
Customer 703.Content: Best dinner I've ever splurged on, would recommend the A5 tasting, tortelloni, and no.9 cocktail

Customer 704.Name: YolandaB
Customer 704.Content: You will not be disappointed. We went for a special occasion and were seated at the chef's counter. The experience was exceptional from beginning to end. The staff, from the front door to the back of the house, is professional, knowledgeable, and top notch. Get there as soon as possible!

Customer 705.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 705.Content:
Took my niece for her 16th birthday. She was so impressed and felt so good eating all the delicious food and sitting in a “fancy” restaurant.
I love the service, beautiful presentation, delicious and unique flavors and great ambiance. My go to for out of town guests.

Customer 706.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 706.Content: Phenomenal, well thought out dishes immaculately plated and delivered by an extremely knowledgeable and personable team. Next level experience that I cannot wait to repeat!

Customer 707.Name: AnnA
Customer 707.Content: On our last night in SF, I was able to get a last minute reservation at a high top and the whole meal was incredible. Probably the best steakhouse we’ve ever been to. We were wowed from start to finish. Highly recommend!!

Customer 708.Name: AdamF
Customer 708.Content: One of the best meals I've ever had.  Period.  Steak was unreal, got to try a bunch of new types that I had never had, service was amazing, vibe and music, perfect, just one of those rare perfect dining experiences from starters to dessert.

Customer 709.Name: Davi
Customer 709.Content: Amazing in every way. Service, food, atmosphere. Couldn’t ask for a better dining experience. A++

Customer 710.Name: LauraO
Customer 710.Content: Dinner was great, however i felt like our waiter did not describe accurately the portions, pretty much making it feel like they are so small. So we end up getting way too much food on the table.  Other than that, food was great, everything we ordered was delicious: we had tortelloni, beef tartar, pig ears, beet salad, wagyu meatballs( 2), tomahawk steak with black truffle, wagyu short ribs, crispy potatoes (2), kimchi (3), buckwheat rolls.

Customer 711.Name: MandyG
Customer 711.Content: Wonderful as always! Crispy potatoes, tomahawk, bone marrow, oysters, and black sesame ice cream are a must!

Customer 712.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 712.Content: Birthday.  Great food but ridiculously expensive

Customer 713.Name: DKSC
Customer 713.Content: Birthday Dinner. Tasting of the Wagyu was amazing. Cod was just ok. Above all the service is the star. Staff is excellent.

Customer 714.Name: JoelM
Customer 714.Content: Great dining experience at the Chefs Counter seeing the action right up front.  Well deserved of their Michelin star! Can’t wait to experience it again.

Customer 715.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 715.Content: We celebrated our 24th Anniversary at Niku. The staff went above and beyond to make us feel special. The service was impeccable, the food is to die for, the cocktails and wine were amazing.

Customer 716.Name: kwkwkw
Customer 716.Content: Fantastic food and unbelievable service. A real winner! We will be back.

Customer 717.Name: VincentC
Customer 717.Content: This was pleasant celebration.  First time diner at Niku with the family and loved it.  The food was prepared with elegance from starters to desert.  The portions were just right, and the ambiance was magnificent.  We spent over three hours eating, drinking, and enjoying the company.

Customer 718.Name: NhanLe
Customer 718.Content: we love the vibe here, food are great and staff is very helpful

Customer 719.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 719.Content: Too notch everything. Service was impeccable, food was to die for.

Customer 720.Name: JamesL
Customer 720.Content: Friendly staff but the food was not up to par. Our steak was too salty and arrived an hr after our last appetizer. None of the servers came by to check on us after the main course arrived at our table and overall would not return or recommend.

Customer 722.Name: AaronH
Customer 722.Content: Amazing food and service. Everything on the menu is outstanding. The staff is super helpful and attentive. The sommeliers (esp Rachel) are world class with an excellent selection. This is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco! Easily deserves two Michelin stars, if not three!

Customer 723.Name: EATINGDAVE
Customer 723.Content: We arrived at 7:30, our main course (tomahawk) was served at 10pm, ridiculous.

Customer 724.Name: FerSuarez
Customer 724.Content: There is No doubt you’ll get the finest meat, that goes along with the price. But it’s worth it, every dish they have is good. However it’s a small place, very loud and energetic, if you don’t mind that, the place is just perfect.

Customer 725.Name: Wina101383
Customer 725.Content: Great meal and great service! Me and my fiancé were very happy with our meal and experience.

Customer 726.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 726.Content: Utterly unforgettable dining experience and some of the best steak I’ve ever had in my life. Wagyu Fat brownie is amazing!

Customer 727.Name: cheeny
Customer 727.Content: From entering the restaurant to leaving, service and the staff members were all great and so friendly and professional. My only qualm was that we had ordered our steak medium-rare and received a medium-well to well done steak that was room temp. We didn't want to cause a fuss and send it back or ask for it to be re-made, and the steak even cooked improperly was delicious. Highly recommend the tartare and grenache as well!

Customer 728.Name: Jennater
Customer 728.Content: I was worried the chef's counter would feel cramped but the bar is long and wide so you have plenty of room to enjoy. The staff were incredibly knowledgeable and attentive. Highly recommend this place.

Customer 729.Name: Chewie
Customer 729.Content:
Great steakhouse. They have all types of steaks and 2 types of wagyu. I recommend the Satsuma Wagyu which reminds me of the time I ate in Tokyo and Kobe.
For appetizers- go for the grilled 1) cauliflower, dungeness crab, miso bagna cauda, cara cara  and 2) bone marrow, short rib, horseradish, bordelaise.  For dessert, I recommend 1) meyer lemon crème brûlée, matcha crumble, page mandarin sorbet and 2) wagyu fat brownie, torched meringue, miso dippin’ dots.

Customer 730.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 730.Content:
Top 5 restaurants I’ve dined with 
Will go anytime I’m in SF

Customer 731.Name: ChaseB
Customer 731.Content: The staff was amazing and helpful. The food was the best I’ve ever had and I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

Customer 732.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 732.Content: Perfect steak to try in once in a month. The customer service could’ve been better. The server was really sweet. Enjoyed the food ! Btw it takes about 2 hours for the food to come.

Customer 733.Name: rbondoc
Customer 733.Content: Service was phenomenal. Our waiter was hilarious and really made the environment feel welcoming. As first timers trying wagyu, we felt that they walked us through what they thought might fit our taste the best - food was incredible! Sitting at the chef’s counter was amazing, we couldn’t stop eyeing all the chefs and the Wagyu!! Thank you again for a great experience!

Customer 734.Name: NorCaliGirl
Customer 734.Content: The house rolls, the bone marrow, and the meatballs are not to be missed! I only wish the music volume was lowered so I can hear what the very knowledgeable staff is saying and so I could hold a convo without shouting. If you're looking for a quiet romantic evening, this place isn't it. But it is extremely delicious.

Customer 735.Name: BeverlyA
Customer 735.Content:
With the exception of one incident at the bar while waiting to be seated, the experience was AMAZING!  
The bar design/set up is classy. The ambience of the restaurant overall is modern & stylish. Staff is super attentive & friendly. Sitting at the Chefs Counter was an excellent choice! 
Every dish ordered was DELICIOUS! For starters: the Wagyu Tartare & Crispy Pig Ears. Entree: Wagyu Short Rib w/ side of Crispy Potato. They definitely take pride in presentation & flavor. Everything was cooked to perfection! 
This is not your ordinary steakhouse and will be added to one of my favorite spots in SF!

Customer 737.Name: DDOC
Customer 737.Content: Fabulous  staff.  Outstanding service.  Thank you.

Customer 738.Name: StephanieM
Customer 738.Content: Nice environment,  excellent staff and we loved the food. It was unique and tasty. We had oyster and bone marrow as starters and wagyu steak with truffle as main corse. I personally loved the ingredients and the sauce that comes with the oyster. Bone marrow was my Husb favorite and finally our wagyu was melting in our mouth.

Customer 739.Name: ACL6
Customer 739.Content: Food was delicious and service was excellent. They were very accommodating to dietary restrictions and made for an overall wonderful experience.

Customer 740.Name: RowenaS
Customer 740.Content: Maria the wine expert was helpful. Our server Ian was funny & helpful with the whiskey. Great times at Niku. Fruit flies were finally removed from the restaurant.

Customer 741.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 741.Content: We loved it!! What an experience!! And 4oz of wagyu was a dream!!

Customer 742.Name: SecondChild
Customer 742.Content: Without a doubt, one of the best meals I've had in my entire life. The service was also exceptional. And, in spite of being quite expensive, it still felt like I was getting a deal due to the high quality of the meal, the exceptional service, and the very generous accoutrements provided by the staff to compliment the experience. I had an amazing time and would very much like to return. Special thanks to my server Eric for his outstanding service, and thanks to the entire staff for making my promotion celebration feel extraordinarily special.

Customer 743.Name: IsraelD
Customer 743.Content: Attentive service. Delicious food. It can get a bit a loud depending on where you’re sitting.  This is also not somewhere to come with a budget as it is a bit pricey.  Music is hip and trendy.  My favorite part of my visit was sitting at the chefs counter being able to see the food and chefs work their magic.  It’s truly a sight to see.  Definitely worth a trip.

Customer 744.Name: AlSo
Customer 744.Content: We sat at the Chef’s counter and had a great time. The wait staff were superb and gave great advice on the drinks and food. Wonderful place to get an authentic taste of Wagyu with a relaxed atmosphere.

Customer 745.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 745.Content: Fantastic experience filled with amazing food. Complimentary dishes were served while waiting for our food. Can’t wait to go back!

Customer 746.Name: RickyM
Customer 746.Content: Incredible experience! Exceptional service, food, ambiance. Parking was very easy to find on the nearby streets (Saturday evening). Complimentary items from the restaurant made our anniversary even more special!

Customer 747.Name: TinaS
Customer 747.Content: I dont know how exactly to say how wonderful our experience was.  It was our first wedding anniversary and this was the perfect place to celebrate.  The food, the people, the whole experience was amazing.  We will definitely be back soon!

Customer 748.Name: RobinR
Customer 748.Content: Rachel, Maria and Franco are awesome! Can’t wait to go back.

Customer 749.Name: SherryL
Customer 749.Content: Exceptional service. Excellent food. Will definitely come back!

Customer 750.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 750.Content:
Everything here was outstanding. Flavorful and beautifully plated. 

Amazing service- everyone who came to us greeted us for our anniversary.

Customer 751.Name: Eddiea
Customer 751.Content: Incredible food with outstanding service.  Well worth it and give an A+ for overall experience.

Customer 752.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 752.Content:
Absolutely awesome experience, and the Michelin star is well deserved; I felt like I was back in Tokyo and the energy was wonderful!  

The only small thing is that the music was a bit too american-clubby; perhaps some Buddha-bar at a medium low volume would give it even more of an international vibe..:-)

Customer 753.Name: LlamaGirl
Customer 753.Content: Absolutely beautiful restaurant and plating. Staff were wonderful and helpful. Sitting at the counter was a special experience. Highly recommend. Chicken fat rice and the wagyu are the way to go.

Customer 754.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 754.Content: This was a Valentine’s. I requested rose petals but it was a bit busy and we did come 30mins early so I wasn’t too disappointed that they didn’t do that. This place is always amazing though. No matter what you order you will get something unique and savory.

Customer 755.Name: Jade
Customer 755.Content: The food was amazing! While the star is the steak, even the vegetable side dishes we ordered (mushrooms and Brussels sprouts) shined. The service was absolutely top notch and everyone who served us seemed to go above and beyond to make sure we had a great first experience. They seem to really enjoy their jobs and making people happy. Definitely an experience to remember!

Customer 756.Name: KateB
Customer 756.Content: We had the most memorable dining experience! Sat at the bar which allowed us to see how food was being plated and how the steaks were prepared. We had the Wagu beef tasting, absolutely phenomenal. Each one had a unique taste so it was great to be able to try three different types of wagu. 10/10!!

Customer 757.Name: ZacharyS
Customer 757.Content: Sampled the A5 wagyu offering, exceeded all expectations, friendly and accommodating staff, excellent experience

Customer 758.Name: Nixi
Customer 758.Content: Food was excellent - steaks, appetizers/sides and dessert. Highly recommend for a good meal

Customer 759.Name: Minh
Customer 759.Content: The service is awesome. Everyone is very careful in detail. The food is amazing too and there are many dishes that on the house. Food is an excellent combination between Japanese + Chinese + American steakhouse. Niku Steakhouse is the rare Michelin restaurant that is not overhype and worth the money!

Customer 760.Name: Jayally
Customer 760.Content: The food was absolutely delicious…The staff were amazing, the drinks on point, the ambience was nice and chill…I loved it..I will definitely be going back and this time seat at the chefs table..

Customer 761.Name: NicholasT
Customer 761.Content: Such an amazing experience all around! From the vibe, to the wine, service and food, we were all blown away.

Customer 762.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 762.Content: The main course tomahawk came out lukewarm, flavor was mild and plain, nothing special for the price. Expected more. Everything else was decent but didn’t wow us enough to want to come back or recommend the place. Service and venue was perfect just the food was lackluster. Unfortunately, we were disappointed about our Valentines dinner.

Customer 763.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 763.Content: From the moment you walk in until you leave you are treated with nothing but the best care. I’ve eaten at many steakhouse throughout the country and have tried which I thought were good steaks/food but nothing compares to Niku Steakhouse. Everything down the drink was absolutely incredible. 10/10 I will be coming back and will be referring this place to as many ppl i come across.

Customer 764.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 764.Content: Amazing everything was spectacular thank you

Customer 765.Name: ZohraR
Customer 765.Content: The food and service here is amazing! Get the wagyu Ribeye, and Crispy potatoes and mushrooms. I'm not if any items change seasonally but I will be back here again. One manager Maria was awesome! She helped us figure out what to drink and order.

Customer 766.Name: MannyK
Customer 766.Content: Great food. We had the tomahawk, potato dumplings, pig ears, chicken fat rice, and mushrooms. Everything paired well with the steak

Customer 767.Name: rivercourt
Customer 767.Content:
Everyone was great!
Service was very attentive.

Customer 768.Name: SAMO
Customer 768.Content: The best restaurant and most creative and talented chef and team in San Francisco!

Customer 769.Name: GraceC
Customer 769.Content: Simply phenomenal.  One of the best meals I've had in my 39 years of life.  Not kidding!

Customer 770.Name: Rina
Customer 770.Content: Everyone was great! As long as the boyfriend was satisfied with the place then everything went well. I initially requested at chefs table but my boyfriend preferred table and they were able to accommodate that request. He was surprised with everything and Niku really came through.  Thanks for having us.

Customer 771.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 771.Content: Amazing place. From the food to the staff, I rate a 5 star experience and a must to go if you’re visiting SF.

Customer 772.Name: HongTada
Customer 772.Content: Beautiful and sexy elegant restaurant!  Food was amazing!  Knowledgeable and friendly staffs!  Definitely coming back!  Hard to get reservations but will try!

Customer 773.Name: Standout
Customer 773.Content: All the appetizers were phenomenal - the chefs counter was also the perfect spot for 2. Cocktails were impeccable. Love this place.

Customer 774.Name: chelsealocal
Customer 774.Content: Best dining experience in years!!!! Highly recommend!!!

Customer 776.Name: Sparrow57
Customer 776.Content: Have always loved Niku, so it worked out perfectly to attend a Warriors game and celebrate a special occasion there afterwards.  Had worked things out ahead of time with the sommelier and maitre d' to ensure everything would be special.  The internal communication seems to have gotten crossed by the time we got there as they first sat us at the wrong table and did not seem to know about any pre-arrangements.  Once that got sorted out after some time, things went better and the food was great as always.  And then, they forgot us again for over 20 minutes before we had to remind them about our dessert.  Overall, I'd go there again for the food, but will lower my expectations about the service.

Customer 777.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 777.Content: This is my favorite steakhouse by far!!! Amazing food and staff.

Customer 778.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 778.Content: Great spot to celebrate a special occasion or a date night. Service was excellent and the food was amazing. What an experience!

Customer 779.Name: Foodforever69
Customer 779.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the appetizers we chose and the desserts! We had all 4 desserts and each of them were incredible and brought unique flavor. The pig ears were INCREDIBLE as well. The tomahawk steak lacked flavor and the waygu tasting was great but not unforgettable. At the end of the day we enjoyed it but is not somewhere I will be sending everyone I know.

Customer 780.Name: Elaine
Customer 780.Content: Food was delicious. Appetizers and sides were outstanding. Drinks were great too especially their gin cocktail Agent 00. We had the tomahawk which was good but will probably not order again since it was quite expensive at $165 and not very memorable. We’d like to try their ribeye and NY steak next time. Service was impeccable!

Customer 781.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 781.Content:
My girlfriend and I went here to celebrate our anniversary. The service was exceptional. We were taken care of with a nice little hand written card and complimentary champagne. Our server made sure to wipe down our table free of crumbs or morsels every so often; so you can already assume they are on top of it. They also fold your napkins neatly if you ever leave the table. 

The food was insanely delicious. If you’re a big fan and nerd for Wagyu, just like myself, then you will definitely love this place. Prices are a little on the higher side, but what can you expect from a place serving some of the best cuts of beef you could ever taste?! 

I love it here and will definitely will be coming back. Also check out their butcher shop right next door! I’m a frequent shopper there.

Customer 782.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 782.Content: Amazing food & great service! Highly recommend

Customer 783.Name: EMILYC
Customer 783.Content: Birthday celebration with my sister! Great food and amazing service. Highly rec the wagyu tortellini.

Customer 784.Name: Christine
Customer 784.Content: My experience at Niku was beyond my expectations. Service was spectacular - our server was very attentive and informative on both the drinks and food. I appreciated his input and recommendations. The atmosphere was beautiful, dark and modern with clean lines. The bar looked really beautiful and we sat at the chefs bar top so had line of sight to the cooking which was cool. Food options were all great and complimented the steaks really well. Did get a bit loud and packed about an hour or two into opening but glad they’re business is doing well. Overall a great experience and glad I got to celebrate a special occasion here.

Customer 785.Name: Mikbel
Customer 785.Content: Amazing steak house, amazing food, great vibes. Sat at chef’s table ! Best decision I made. Going back to try other menu options !

Customer 786.Name: bumblebee
Customer 786.Content: For the price of the steaks, I thought they would be melt in your mouth, tender steaks. Instead the steaks were tough and chewy. I have had a steak half the price that was more tender and came with edible plating. This steak had no plating whatsoever. It was just a steak on a plate. The music was played so loudly that I couldn't hear the person I was with speaking. BUT the service was excellent and top notch. The servers are super kind there. That was pretty much the only plus.

Customer 787.Name: ChrisL
Customer 787.Content: Service and ambience was superb. Food was good. Definitely a nice place for a special occasion or even a date.

Customer 788.Name: Joslyn
Customer 788.Content: We went for my son's birthday dinner, and it couldn't have been more special.  We got the Wagyu Tasting plus a tenderloin and much more and the food and service were exceptional.  So glad we went.

Customer 789.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 789.Content: Amazing dinner. We loved the ribeye and the mushrooms but the tortelli, rolls, and potatoes were tasty as well. Must orders. Cocktails were delicious. We sat at the chefs counter and loved the front row seat. We can’t wait to go back for the short rib — it looked unreal. Corkage is $60/bottle. Only minor gripe is that our server seemed to have no opinion — when we asked for recommendations he just guided us with “it depends what you like…think about what you like and then go in that direction.” Food was excellent so you can’t go wrong, but would have been nice to be guided a little more.

Customer 790.Name: Emily
Customer 790.Content: Our dinner at Niku was an incredible experience, from the personal greeting when we walked in the door to the end of our meal. One of the best meals of my life!

Customer 792.Name: RonaldH
Customer 792.Content: Had an amazing dining experience and the food was phenomenal. Will definitely go back to try the other small plates.

Customer 793.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 793.Content: It was the absolute best dining experience weve have jad in a while!!

Customer 794.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 794.Content: Amazing food & staff! Came here for our one year engagement anniversary and it did not disappoint! Right when we came in, the staff was so friendly. We got seated right away at the chef’s table( we had reservation & vaccine cards were checked )  and the staff greeted us with a very cute card & a glass of bubbles on the house- which was so Sweet and really set up the mood for the entire dinner. Moving forward, every tiny little step towards dinner for so organized and neat. Really did felt we were taken care of beyond any service we experienced even in very high end places. During diner, we had the best view of the kitchen and was just an exciting environment to be In. We shared this place with our close friends & can’t wait to come back again 🤗

Customer 795.Name: VivianH
Customer 795.Content: The steak is decent but not worth the price. The service doesn’t not meet my expectation at all

Customer 796.Name: Wombat
Customer 796.Content:
Food is good. The tasting is a good experience but I’m curious about the other dishes so I’ll for sure come back

Staff is very friendly and answers all your questions

Customer 797.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 797.Content: Wonderful food. In some aspects, the small Plates and sides outshined the steaks ( though we ordered the short rib and ribeye). Next time we will order the A5 sampler

Customer 798.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 798.Content: Had a great Christmas Eve meal at Niku. They had a well curated prix fix menu. The food was great, the seasonal cocktails were inspired and the service was top notch. I am looking forward to visiting again and exploring their regular menu.

Customer 800.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 800.Content: Phenomenal!! The team at Niku made our night, the best experience I’ve had in years! Listen to the Sommelier, she was absolutely amazing. The kitchen took care of us too. I’m looking forward to seeing Niku get attention for their wonderful hospitality!

Customer 801.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 801.Content: I definitely can’t wait to come back and enjoy!

Customer 803.Name: Nadsk
Customer 803.Content: A5 wagyu steak wasn't hot when it came out and was still under lukewarm temp when we sent it back to be reheated. Also missed the mark based on how long we waited for steak.

Customer 804.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 804.Content: We were given the chefs table which was amazing ! we really enjoyed the ambiance of the location. The liquor menu was amazing. My partner thoroughly enjoyed the whiskey selections. We got both the ribeye and the strip. Definitely enjoyed the ribeye more but the strip was still cooked extremely well. overall we would come back for any special date night

Customer 805.Name: Matt
Customer 805.Content: These guys deserve a Michelin star. Service was impeccable, the food was incredible, drinks were great (I recommend the Harajuku), the sides were delicious. The staff at Niku will make sure that you’re taken care of and you have a great experience. 10/10 will definitely return in the future. An unforgettable experience!

Customer 806.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 806.Content:
Food was great, really. Meat was perfectly mid-rare and the crispy potatoes were very good.

Service in general was very good. It is highly likely we will be back.

Customer 807.Name: KCWL
Customer 807.Content: Absolutely delicious! Love the smokiness and sear in every bite! Will go back again and again!

Customer 808.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 808.Content:
we were immediately greeted and seated as we walked in for our 9 pm reservation. service was attentive and concise which i greatly appreciated and seldom see in the food industry. questions regarding the menu displayed their knowledge of the food, and the in house sommelier took her time to explain and help find the perfect wine pairing for our food. 
Now for the food: 
for small plates we had the bone marrow, perfect serving size for 2 people. cooked to the perfect temperature, very flavorful and an excellent prequel to the main course. 
main dish
we had the tomahawk steak cooked medium rare, this large piece of heaven is cooked on their wood grill and is sliced off the bone after resting and just prior to serving. it is served with the bone on side and i highly recommend eating whatever remains on it as its packed with flavor. the meat was cooked to perfection, flavorful perfect char to the outside and robust pink in the middle.
side dish
we has their infamous house rolls (4 rolls) served with wagyu fat butter; once paired together and bitten the bread simply melts away , leaving you satisfied but not full.
dessert:
chocolate brownie with wagyu fat and dippin dots.
just order it. 
alcohol menu is extensive, especially their wine list. 
ambiance is dressy casual, noise is moderate but not to the point where you cannot hear at your table or hold a conversation at a normal volume. reservations highly suggested, and uber/lift.
